Dutch is a plus.Complex international calendar management experience is a mustGood knowledge of the office 365 package is requiredGood knowledge and ability to facilitate hybrid meetings and eventsExperience working in dynamic international environmentsExperience working for multiple stakeholders is highly preferredPlease note we can only consider candidates already living in The Netherlands.SkillsAs a Medior Management Assistant you:Pro-actively identify and fulfill customer needs.Have a learning mind-set and are not afraid of making mistakesCommunicate clearly and concisely with different stakeholdersConsistently achieve results, even under tough circumstancesCollaborate with your team to get the work doneLearn fast and pick up tasks quicklyWork accurately and have an eye for detailsHandle business matters with discretion and confidentiality.Diversity & InclusionASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. IntroductionIntroduction to the jobAre you keen to take up a new challenge in a global fast growing company? Are you looking for a next step in your career and would enjoy enabling ASML business to achieve its objectives while being in control?We are looking for you: A Senior Financial Controller Sales who is responsible for the accounting, analysis and monitoring relating to the sales activities within the Global Enabling Services – Financial Services (GES - FS) Systems & UF Sales department of ASML. You will act as liaison with other departments and stakeholders, ensure complaint, proper and timely financial administration and reporting in compliance with US GAAP, other local GAAP and IFRS revenue recognition guidance.The position is the linking-pin between the customer business controllers, local business controllers and the central revenue accounting & reporting department of ASML. It is a challenging position in a hectic, dynamic and international oriented environment with tight deadlines and direct impact on ASML’s financial results. A position with many growth opportunities within ASML.Role And ResponsibilitiesThe focus in this position is ensuring effective and efficient processing of financial transactions by team members. This needs to be done by:Continuous forward looking and making sure that all transactions are substantiated and can be explained (to all stakeholders internally and externally)Alignment with the business control counterpart ensuring that the planning will not deviate from the actual processingMonitoring complaint accountingContinuous balance monitoringWhat makes this role interestingInteraction with business: such as Business control and local sales controlA team that has a consistent drive from identifying and implementation of improvementsMain responsibilities:Together with the entire team, responsible for worldwide System and UF salesLiaise with Business control, local sales control and Accounting Experts throughout the execution of the contract to ensure proper revenue recognition in external reporting;First point of contact for external and internal auditors. IntroductionIntroduction to the jobIf you have a passion for Project Management, Change Management and continuous improvement then this could be your next job!On-time market introduction of ASML’s newest technologies requires an amazing product, effective processes and efficient execution. It needs a continuous drive to improve to secure the efficiency, effectiveness and profitability of ASML’s business. We are optimizing the processes, tools and reports in which we manage the operational execution, by managing successful improvement projects delivering the solutions we need.Are you challenged by:managing and leading cross functional improvement projects?engaging internal customers and managing stakeholder expectations?creating what is needed, not necessarily what is asked?offering solutions to satisfy the demanding user community?continuously improving processes, tools and reports?defining and maintaining a way of working for implementing changes?working within a multi-disciplinary team?Then we are looking for you! Be a part of ASML. Be a part of progress. Be part of the team.Role And ResponsibilitiesWithin ASML the Program Management Office (PMO) optimizes business value in project, program and portfolio management execution to strengthen ASML’s competitive position.Our mission is to drive world-class project, program and portfolio management across Business Lines and Development & Engineering department.As PMO Improvement Lead your mission is to setup and manage the change portfolio execution to structurally enable and improve business execution, driving towards optimal processes, tools and reports to reach our business objectives.As PMO Improvement lead you will be an independent team member of the business and you will be responsible for:Managing the triple constraint of your own change projects;Pro-actively Connecting, enabling and challenging all stakeholders;Continuously Challenging the status quo of business execution, triple constraint management and organizational governance;Driving optimized business value by effective project execution and decision makingon all levels;Implementing and Improving project (program) standards and processes;Have a keen understanding of project execution processes, tools and information such as; Project planning, Financial management, Product generation processes, reporting, change control, risk management and quality;Growing people and team competences of PMO and ASML’s Project Management community, e.g. by driving, participating, leading & implementing cross-PMO improvement projects;Building standards for change management and continuous improvements within the business.And finally, creating winning teams by living our values and building capabilities for the future.Education And ExperienceMaster’s degree in a relevant field.Minimum of 8 years working experience as project/program/portfolio management (PMO) expert or practical experience as a project manager in a complex, multi-disciplinary environment.Extensive experience with managing and implementing change- and improvement projects.Preferably experience in a high tech environment.Preferably experience with Operational Excellence and Continuous ImprovementSkillsWorking at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:Excellent Project manager, being able to provide clarity in scope, agree and align on timing and manage cost for their (improvement) projectSetup and maintain effective project teamsExcellent communicator, being able to influence without hierarchical power, and creative in managing a large and diverse range of stakeholdersMaintain personal effectiveness and people focus under pressure, high speed of change and uncertaintyAbility to guide, coach and advise at all organizational levels to effect sustainable change and improving the project and process maturity level of the organizationTeam player, enjoy working in multidisciplinary and multicultural teams with the ability to work independentlyTake ownership, gets things done and pro-actively drives for improvementDiversity & InclusionASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. IntroductionAfter a system is shipped to a customer abroad, the real ‘magic’ begins. Thousands of engineers worldwide are dedicated to this one goal: making sure that the lithography systems at our customers’ sites are running smoothly, 24/7. That makes the Customer Support (CS) department vital to our success. The expectation from ASML’s customers is a continuous improvement of the added value of delivered services and optimization of costs. To support the rapid growth of our business we need to introduce standardized processes and supporting IT-systems. To realize those challenging goals, a strong portfolio and project management organization is required.Job DescriptionAs our Installed base business will be doubling in the coming 5 years, we are looking for a Business Program Manager to execute programs to enable the business for this growth. You as a PM will lead a business priority program to fulfill the strategy that is outlined to realize the business goals set. The Business Program Manager uses his/her deep knowledge to execute CS wide Business Improvement Projects by using best-practices of ASML and/or broad experience in similar industries together with proven Program Management and Change Management skills. These programs run from the roadmap driven concept phase to the embedding of the improvement in the standard CS daily operation.As program manager or Chief Product Owner you are responsible for realization of strategic business improvements for an assigned capability. This typically requires a multi-year program, involvement of several sectors, impacting >60 sites globally. You organize the program governance, you define the program roadmap and initiate the workstreams that design, deliver and implement the required deliverables and ensure business value.Both program manager and Chief Product Owner are responsible for an assigned business capability. A Chief Product Owner operates within the governance of a SAFe/Agile organization, a program manager organizes his/her own governance. To be successful you need to have a broad skillset:Business leader; you shape and drive the improvements needed to realize the strategic benefits for your program, in close collaboration with the business owner and sponsor group Stakeholder manager; you align the various stakeholders within sectors and regions and effectively address a broad range of interests.Organization skills; you structure, plan and manage a layered project organization.People management required to steer, motivate and coach your teams Collaboration with central & local business management as well as other disciplines and change initiatives is key to your success.Who are you?EducationMaster degree in business administration, industrial engineering or technical areaExperienceA combination of 2 or more of the following experience area’s:Over 8 year of Program Management experience, preferably combined with relevant experience in managing and implementing change in large, decentralized organizations;Over 8 years of business experience in different roles in a Customer Support or similar environment including operational responsibilities and with a clear process improvement mindset;Over 5 years’ experience with culture change and the soft aspects/people aspects of organizational development;Extensive experience in ASML is an explicit advantage;Over 5 years of experience in Agile WoW is an advantage;Additional job-related knowledge and/or managerial experience: operational (hands-on) experience in Service, Logistics, (Lean) manufacturing and/or industrial engineering environment, (senior) line management roles in operations, knowledge of financial management;Experience in consultancy in high-tech and/or service environments. Personal SkillsWorking at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.Excellent communication skills;High level of interpersonal and organizational sensitivity;Empathy, ability to “read” people: understand values and motives that drive behavior;Excellent ability to thrive in a multi-cultural environment with a global footprint;Seniority, in interpersonal sense and business knowledge;Flexibility, adapt to company culture and individual behavior;Ability to work from a broad scope, integrating people, processes, capabilities, technologies, and the details at the same time;Goal oriented, is motivated by realizing goals and by implementing effective change rather than personal acknowledgement;Ability to create and maintain a large trusted network on all levels of the organization;Able to convince, inspire and motivate people;Able to cooperate with people of different departments and levels within the ASML organization;Continuous Improvement & Process oriented mindset;Self-starter with drive, enthusiasm and persistence. Diversity & InclusionASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.Other InformationThe holder of this position reports to the Head of CS Business Performance Improvement Programs. He or she has interfaces to New Product Introduction program management, CS IT program management, regional CS organizations, CS Supporting departments, CS Service Architects,CS senior management team, CS finance, CS HR and Business Lines Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

IntroductionIntroduction to the jobAre you challenged by working closely together with our suppliers and ASML teams to ensure the right quality, on time delivery and costs of our parts and modules in our supply chain throughout the entire product life cycle? Do you like to turn the technology roadmap of ASML into industrialized solutions?If yes, then join the Sourcing & Supply Chain Project Lifecycle Management (PLM) department as a Supply Chain New Product Introduction Project Manager.Job MissionYou will work closely together with the supplier and ASML teams enabling the introduction, industrialization and ramp-up of new developed parts and modules at our suppliers. These teams focus on Quality, Logistics, Technology, Costs and Sustainability (QLTCS) of complex modules. Teams consist of Supplier Quality Engineer(s), Logistic Supplier Management, Product Lifecycle Coordinators, Development Engineers, Sourcing Leads and Re-use experts. The Supply Chain NPI Project Manager uses the right expertise and project management skills to ensure the QLTCS roadmap targets are set and met on time, before release for volume.Role And ResponsibilitiesCreating and motivating a x-sector team to achieveindustrialization targets at our suppliers taken into account thecomplexity and time pressureApply Early Supplier Involvement and ConcurrentEngineering to meet the urgent timelineDrive for efficiency (and speed) by assessing the(n-tier) supplier process flow and applying bottleneck managementDefining and agreeing on the right QLTCS roadmaptargets and actively give follow-upProactive reporting out the project status towards thePLM Program Manager If applicable report-out status and (containment)actions in the appropriate level of our escalation boardsChallenging the technology specifications versus themanufacturability at supplier and driving scenario-based evaluation toarrive at the best solution.Defining creative solutions with the team in the n-tiersupply chain of the supplier to mitigate risk and issues Keep track of the configuration of the first deliveredparts/modules to secure commonality in the early phasesEducation and experienceMaster's degree with min 8 years relevant work-experienceProven track record in project management and leading x-sector teamsProven track record to improve efficiency and effectivity in technical production environmentExperience in interfacing with suppliers on industrialization targetsExperience in out-of-the-box creative problem solving and solution thinkingExperience in bottleneck management of manufacturing processes SkillsWorking at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.Personal SkillsStrong negotiation skills for interacting with other sectors and suppliersThe drive, energy and initiative to achieve continuous improvementStakeholder management: deal effectively with internal and external stakeholders both at operational and executive levelsStrong business sense enabling optimal balancing of stakeholders' interestsNatural leader with technical aptitudePro-active problem solver, action and result orientedOrganize cross functional cooperationAble to coach team membersExcellent professional communication in English. Dutch preferred Diversity & InclusionASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.Other InformationContext of this positionYou start during the earliest phase of the Product Life Cycle. Based on the supply chain risk we define the complex parts for a new product. You will lead the process to bring one or more of these complex parts towards industrialization. If applicable you will be involved in supply chain design and supplier selection process. Once the supplier is known you will start the industrialization process with the supplier. Since the teams develop high tech modules against challenging timeline, most of the time material availability is at risk. We do apply concurrent engineering when creating the design and parts/module manufacturing at the supplier. While doing this you have to make sure you manage the timely industrialization of these complex parts during the execution of the manufacturing process at the supplier.Examples of QLTCS roadmap targets you secure for the first deliveries, ramp up and volume are:Quality: Analyze supplier feedback, Process FMEAs, optimize manufacturing flow (across suppliers), Yield, Material Notifications, Quality-docs;Logistics: Supplier cycle time, Move rate at supplier, Flexibility of the move rate, Material availability;Technology: Design FMEA’s, Technical issue management at supplier, Completeness design documentation;Costs: Cost of Goods and total cost of ownership, Supplier investments;Sustainability: Refurbishment/repair capabilities, Re-use of modules/partsDuring this process, some of the foreseen risks become issues. Until the part/module is industrialized you are responsible to mitigate and ultimately solve these problems with the teams and supplier. This includes organizing a successful x-sector team with sufficient solving power, as well as regular report out towards senior management.Travel required: 20-25%Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions .This position requires access to U.S. controlled technology, as defined in the United States Export Administration Regulations. Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such U.S. controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with applicants who are immediately eligible to access U.S. controlled technology. Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

IntroductionIntroduction to the jobAre you challenged by a supply chain over 7 tiers deep? Do you want to contribute solving the worlds chip shortage and deliver input for ASML’s supplier strategy? If so, we should talk!ASML is looking for a Logistics Supplier Manager with experience in a manufacturing supply chain environment. Building, developing and creating improvements to drive operational excellence at our suppliers and represent the supplier towards our internal stakeholders and customers will be the main responsibilities within this position. Together we help to build the most amazing, complex machines that you will ever see. Watch the video to learn more: ASML IN 1 MINUTERole And ResponsibilitiesAs a Logistics Supplier Manager, you are responsible to drive Logistics Management and Operational Performance of a selected number of key suppliers in the ASML Logistics supply chain. The continuously increasing business demands make this a challenge. You’ll work to provide a reliable, responsive and robust global supply chain network which delivers materials to the factory and the field at the right moment, in the right quantity and quality against the lowest integral costs.Your main responsibilities as a Logistics Supplier Manager are: SkillsDrive Operational Excellence Performance at suppliers and their n-tier suppliers, securing 95% on-time delivery performance to ASML.Securing sufficient capacity at your suppliers to facilitate the ASML growth.Optimize manufacturing processes at suppliers to own and drive material availability crisis to a successful outcome.Represent Logistics as member of Supplier Account Team.Lead a cross sectoral team for several projects.Work with ASML stakeholders to shape our future supply chain.Drive process improvements at suppliers; actively participating in improvement projects at suppliers.Education and experience To help us tackle the challenges we face, you have:A master’s or bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management or similar.10+ years relevant work experience in similar roles with international scope or in a production logistics environment.Experience in improvement & operational excellence in manufacturing / supply chain environment.Experience in (supplier-) account management.Experience in High tech, low volume industries is a pre.Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve. To further thrive as a Logistics Supplier Manager, you need the following skills:Excellent stakeholder management and relationship building skills.Analytical and conceptual thinker on strategic level.Pragmatic and result driven.Managing ambiguity.Pro-active attitude, drive for improvement.Flexible and adaptable.What do we offer?The role of Logistics Supplier Manager offers a unique and challenging job in which you have many opportunities of growth within your supply chain career. You’ll receive a fulltime and permanent job with continuous training to develop yourself. IntroductionIntroduction to the jobASML is the world's leading provider of lithography systems for the semiconductor industry, manufacturing complex machines that are critical to the production of integrated circuits or chipsMulti e-Beam Inspection tools are part of ASML’s holistic lithography portfolio. ASML has an Electron Optical competence center in Delft with multi-disciplinary teams where we have combined Research with Development & Engineering.Job MissionASML Delft delivers modules and SEM systems for ASML’s multi e-beam inspection programs. As Quality Manager for you take responsibility for the definition, alignment and execution of the Quality strategy and roadmap within the ASML Delft department.Role And ResponsibilitiesAs Quality Manager you will: Define and align the department’s quality strategy as member of the department management staff. Execute and report on process improvement projects as part of the quality strategy at department level and/or sector level. Lead/participate in project teams in analyzing process gaps, identifying improvements, support implementation and securing consolidation within the department. Provide input from department into cluster and sector Quality roadmap and vice versa. Report on quality status, communicate quality message in groups and on department level. Improve transparency. Support and coach project teams and their engineers on the quality of technical solutions proposed and deliverables produced. Maintain and deploy department’s processes, providing regular reporting on process adherence to group leaders and project leaders. Facilitate lessons Learned in the various departmental groups and competences.Education and experience Master degree (M.Sc.) in Physics, Electronics or any other technical oriented study with relevant experience in the field of (technical) Quality Management. More than 8 years of work experience in technically-driven international organization(s), preferably within a development environment. Experience as quality manager. Experienced in quality methods and tools like e.g., 6 Sigma, value stream analysis, 5 Why’s analysis, Kaizen, brainstorming sessions, problem solving techniques, FMEA, 8D , Ishikawa diagrams. Knowledgeable in international quality standards. (ISO9001/14001/ TS16949), (development) process assessments and audits.SkillsWorking at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills: Ability to manage complex relationships between various professional disciplines and organizational levels. Excellent stakeholder management and team leader skills, able to collaborate across all levels of the organization with an open attitude. Excellent ability to manage change with the ability to overcome resistance and persist in achieving mission. Strong communication skills, good listener, with the ability to present information verbally and in written format. Self-propelling - learning & (Quality) improvement mindset and change management. Hands-on mentality to get the job done. Drive for continuous improvement; making use of the lessons learned. Strong analytical ability with a pragmatic attitude. Affinity with Agile work methods. Good communication skills and knowledge of English language.Diversity & InclusionASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. With a continuous growing demand for faster delivery of latest technology, good Quality and reliability becomes more and more challenging. This means that our processes must become more effective and efficient. We do this by monitoring and driving success, pro-actively ensuring product Quality (Quality control), securing process adherence and implement lessons learned (Quality assurance) and continuously improve our Way of Working (Quality improvement).The Quality Manager for AMSL Delft will directly report to the Cluster Quality Manager who is located in Veldhoven, and functionally to the Department manager in Delft. IntroductionASML is an innovation leader in the semiconductor industry. We provide microchip makers with everything they need – hardware, software and services – to mass produce patterns on silicon through lithography.The department Business Intelligence & Analytics (BI&A) enables ASML to define programs and prioritize resources and modules, all based on facts from analytics.Within this team we are looking for someone who has experience leading projects in business intelligence and analytics. Someone who is up for a new challenge in a high exposure role within our Business Performance Improvement (BPI) organization.Job MissionYou will lead a project and a team of Business Analytics Analysts and a Product Owner to deliver BI&A products and services according to a cross-sectoral aligned plan/roadmap. You will enable delivery of ASML and customer insights and create value.Job DescriptionCreate and use detailed team plan (deliverables, who, when). Define deliverables for the Business Analytics Analysts;Support, mentor and coach the team of Business Analytics Analysts on a day-to-day basis to deliver upon plan, by providing learning opportunities and feedback. Ensure team is at right information level. Connect with and facilitate collaboration amongst cross-sector business stakeholders;Lead the successful delivery of new BI&A products and services according to plan and on time. Cultivate data-driven leadership across the ASML organization and influence decision-making without a direct reporting line. EducationA (technical) master degree is a must. We prefer a background in Mathematics, Physics, Econometrics or Engineering.ExperienceAt least 3 years of experience in a Project Lead role;Proven track record in consultancy;Experience with project management with multiple senior stakeholders in a high tech manufacturing industry client environment;Knowledge of working with data platforms, data analysis and visualization tools and techniques (hands-on experience with Alteryx and Spotfire);Excellent stakeholder management;Experience with risk and issue management;A big plus is the understanding of the ASML business ecosystem. Personal skillsCurious attitude and eager to solve problems;Pragmatic, pro-active, ‘self-propelling’ way of working and able to operate in a dynamic environment;A reliable team player and good listener;Effective communication, influencing and presentation skills;Coaching and mentoring;Ability to collaborate, bring people together, challenge their opinions and influence without hierarchy;Observe the wishes and needs of the customer, anticipate on them and then act accordingly. Context of the positionYou will be working in the department BPI BI & Analytics.Other InformationThis position may require access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R.730, et seq.). IntroductionMedior management assistantIntroduction to the jobDoes giving support to managers in a dynamic, high demanding, international environment energize you?Due to our growth, we are continuously searching for new talent of all levels. We like to welcome a pro-active team player who can deliver high quality services to our Management Support Organization (MSO).ASML is a leading provider of advanced technology systems for the semiconductor industry. We make machines that make chips – the hearts of the devices that keep us informed, entertained and safe; that improve our quality of life and help to tackle the world’s toughest problems. We build some of the most amazing machines that you will ever see, and the software to run them. Over 26.000 people in 16 countries are currently employed by ASML.Within ASML, the Management Support Organization (MSO) team is organized in one central department consisting of around 130 people strong, supporting over 400 managers. ASML is growing fast, so will the support of our ASML top managers.Are you ready to be part of our progress?Role And ResponsibilitiesAs Medior Management Assistant you act as an ambassador for ASML and MSO, both internally & externally. You support the managers in an administrative & organized way, applying proactivity, initiative, discretion and confidentiality, to guarantee an effective and efficient execution of all management support activities. You are the linking pin between your managers, your colleagues and the various ASML departments and other stakeholders. You need to be able to communicate effectively with all stakeholders and identify issues which require action.Together with your team you provide high quality services to ASML top management. IntroductionIntroduction to the jobThe core values of ASML are Challenge, Collaborate and Care. We are proud of who we are, of our achievements, and how we accomplish these achievements. And, above all, we are one of the leading providers of lithography systems for the semiconductor industry. The employees of ASML share a passion for technology with a customer focus. At ASML one works continuously on the development and implementation of complex and high-quality technological systems. Working at ASML is therefore challenging and dynamic.Within ASML the sector Development & Engineering (D&E) is responsible for the design and specifications of ASML’s products. The department System Integration is part of D&E and responsible to manage risk during the integration phase of our products. Proto systems are used to verify the design concept at system level, which includes hardware and software.For the first time in ASML history will be perform System Integration outside ASML’s cleanroom. Around mid-2023 one of the Proto Integration systems will be relocated to Imec (Leuven-BE). This system will stay there for at least 2 years.Role And ResponsibilitiesAs a Proto Engineer EUV 24x7 you are responsible for the execution of the daily plan created by the Proto Integrator to support D&E project with their tests to validate the design at IMEC (Leuven – Belgium).You are responsible for:Safety and wellbeing Ensuring safe working environment and work according 5S principles.Quality is our habit Keeping the assigned machines in perfect state, i.e., hard and software, configuration up to date and well-functioning.Drive integration Ensuring efficient and effective integration activities on the machines, by Execute test plans on the machine in a most efficient way; Escalate in case problems cannot be solved by yourself; Provide technical support to D&E engineers; Review and prepare test plans.Determining whether issues are related to new design or proto system and solve and report the issues.Challenge, collaborate and care Proto integration is where things comes together. The product, the process, the people. Your behavior is therefore crucial to ensure we will reach our goals together in the end!Daily interface consist of Proto Engineers, Proto Integrator, System Test Engineer, Proto Configuration Engineer, D&E projects and the local IMEC team. In this role you will report to your local team manager and home group Lead.Education And ExperienceTechnical Bachelor (BsC/BEng) or Master (MSc) degree. Preferred fields of study: Physics, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics, Aerospace Engineering, Chemical Engineering.There are no constraints on working experience. The following items are a pre:Experience in a multi-disciplined and dynamic work environment.Knowledge of measurement systems and/or testing system functionality.Working with complex systems. SkillsWorking at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.We are looking for people with a strong personality and who will bring enthusiasm and flexibility into their job on a daily basis. It is unique that ASML is doing integration work outside ASML premises. Therefore, we expect people to be:Capable to communicate on all levels. So internal and external (Imec) stakeholders.Ensure a strong connection with their Veldhoven stakeholders.Proactive attitude with an autonomous mindset.Open to support CS when priority allows.The power to defend your own opinion.Willingness to invest in personal development. Diversity & InclusionASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.Other InformationThe vacancy Proto engineer EUV 24x7, means that you will be working on shifts.Work schedule in 10-day cycle:2 days Morning shift: 6:00 - 14:302 days Evening shift: 14:00 - 22:302 days Night shift: 22:00 - 06:304 days offOn top of the inconvenience allowance for working in shifts you will be receiving Business Travel Plus benefits for your allocation in Belgium.Candidates need to commit for at least 2-year allocation at Imec. IntroductionIntroduction to the jobDo you want to take pride in enabling the rapid growth that ASML is facing by supporting the development, construction and maintenance of high quality real estate and facilities? Then working with us at ASML Corporate Real Estate must sound as a great opportunity to you.Our CRE Netherlands department is responsible for all CRE activities/responsibilities for the Netherlands portfolio and ensure alignment with CRE strategy, business continuity and operational excellence in accordance with CRE’s foundational elements.The Space Planner is responsible for planning and managing the utilization of space in various locations of the organization in the Netherlands, while ensuring optimal functionality, efficiency, and cost-effectiveness. The purpose of the Space Planner is to manage the space planning to optimize the housing demand and supply within the Netherlands and to combine this with an efficient and effective housing plan, based on an intended and purposeful vision.Role And ResponsibilitiesThe role of Space Planner entails the following key responsibilities.Develop, maintain and deploy office housing planning for workplace demand, new buildings, rebuilding, ABW projects, small and large relocations.Create new way of working in housing space management, build this up into a solid baseline and develop into mature and professional level in line with stakeholders.Solve medium- and short-term housing issues, considering information about projects, occupancy and business needs to achieve best-fit solutions.Translate strategic housing issues into tactical solutions to be delegated to housing solutions specialist and services.Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in space planning and design and implement these.Translate applicable housing data, share and discuss with CRE NL Business Partners in order to create the correct housing solutions.Map and safeguard the balance between workplace solutions like work & meeting space, technical areas, warehousing, training centers and service area’s and find applicable solutions where necessary.Analyze existing space usage and identify opportunities to optimize the utilization of space.Conduct feasibility studies to evaluate the potential of renovating sites and make recommendations to management.Collaborate with REDS and CRE CoE to ensure space usage is aligned with business needs and financial objectives.Track and report on space usage and occupancy rates to identify trends and inform future planning decisions.Provide guidance and support to departmental leaders in the selection and design of new workspaces based on the Workplace Experience Book developed by CRE CoE. IntroductionIntroduction to the jobASML is the world's leading provider of lithography systems for the semiconductor industry, manufacturing complex machines that are critical to the production of integrated circuits or chipsMulti e-Beam Inspection tools are part of ASML’s holistic lithography portfolio. ASML has an Electron Optical competence center in Delft with multi-disciplinary teams where we have combined Research with Development & Engineering.Job MissionASML Delft delivers modules and SEM systems for ASML’s multi e-beam inspection programs. As Quality Manager for you take responsibility for the definition, alignment and execution of the Quality strategy and roadmap within the ASML Delft department.Role And ResponsibilitiesAs Quality Manager you will: Define and align the department’s quality strategy as member of the department management staff. Execute and report on process improvement projects as part of the quality strategy at department level and/or sector level. Lead/participate in project teams in analyzing process gaps, identifying improvements, support implementation and securing consolidation within the department. Provide input from department into cluster and sector Quality roadmap and vice versa. Report on quality status, communicate quality message in groups and on department level. Improve transparency. Support and coach project teams and their engineers on the quality of technical solutions proposed and deliverables produced. Maintain and deploy department’s processes, providing regular reporting on process adherence to group leaders and project leaders. Facilitate lessons Learned in the various departmental groups and competences.Education and experience Master degree (M.Sc.) in Physics, Electronics or any other technical oriented study with relevant experience in the field of (technical) Quality Management. More than 8 years of work experience in technically-driven international organization(s), preferably within a development environment. Experience as quality manager. Experienced in quality methods and tools like e.g., 6 Sigma, value stream analysis, 5 Why’s analysis, Kaizen, brainstorming sessions, problem solving techniques, FMEA, 8D , Ishikawa diagrams. Knowledgeable in international quality standards. (ISO9001/14001/ TS16949), (development) process assessments and audits.SkillsWorking at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills: Ability to manage complex relationships between various professional disciplines and organizational levels. Excellent stakeholder management and team leader skills, able to collaborate across all levels of the organization with an open attitude. Excellent ability to manage change with the ability to overcome resistance and persist in achieving mission. Strong communication skills, good listener, with the ability to present information verbally and in written format. Self-propelling - learning & (Quality) improvement mindset and change management. Hands-on mentality to get the job done. Drive for continuous improvement; making use of the lessons learned. Strong analytical ability with a pragmatic attitude. Affinity with Agile work methods. Good communication skills and knowledge of English language.Diversity & InclusionASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. With a continuous growing demand for faster delivery of latest technology, good Quality and reliability becomes more and more challenging. This means that our processes must become more effective and efficient. We do this by monitoring and driving success, pro-actively ensuring product Quality (Quality control), securing process adherence and implement lessons learned (Quality assurance) and continuously improve our Way of Working (Quality improvement).The Quality Manager for AMSL Delft will directly report to the Cluster Quality Manager who is located in Veldhoven, and functionally to the Department manager in Delft. A great role to learn and grow!’ -Jan Keller,Executive Vice President Strategic Sourcing & Supply ChainThe Strategic Sourcing Project Manager role might be the perfect spot for you to broaden your experience or even make a switch in your career into a commercial function and still be very intimately engaged with high tech technologies and system engineering/product design.With the vast majority of parts being sourced externally, that team is key to success. The Strategic Sourcing Project Manager uses his/her strategic and analytical capabilities along with his/her excellent stakeholder management skills to develop the sourcing strategy that prolongs AMSL’s amazing business performance.Role And ResponsibilitiesThe Strategic Sourcing Project Manager is responsible for:making make-buy proposals on new products and new technologies for decision in the executive committee of ASML. develop the supply strategy for areas such as Optics, Mechatronics & Mechanics and Electrical Sourcing together with the responsible Category manager and all cross-sector stakeholders: Technology, Operations, Finance and Legal.This includes: landscaping the supply base, creating early supplier involvement in development projects balancing long-term supply capacity with expected market requirements, prevents strategic lock-ins, optimizes deal structures to maximize ASML’s Total Cost of Ownership, and scouts new suppliers. Building expertise to help building strategic deal structures in order to execute and capitalize on the different sourcing strategies that are developed: strategic deal making. IntroductionIntroduction to the jobIntroductionTogether with her customers and suppliers ASML is heading towards an interesting and challenging era growing today’s company into and beyond 20bE company, playing a crucial role in the semiconductor industry globally. Your job will be in an internationally focused, driven, dynamic, and deadline orientated environment.Are you challenged by contributing to our successful world-class finance department as a hands-on Senior Financial Controller? Do you have the passion and ability to improve and automate existing processes taking into account tax requirements? Why not join us?Job MissionAt ASML we constantly have to ensure that our people, processes and information enable us to realize our growth and meet our ambitious business objectives. Especially in an exciting era of automation, digitalization, robotics and data mining, enabling ASML’s future growth and its success.Recently ASML has launched its transformation towards Global Enabling Services (GES) to deliver world-class transactional & operational support services organized around End to End (E2E) processes. Finance and IT are the first movers soon expected to be followed by other services. Within Finance we have established the E2E cycles, Record to Report, Invoice to Pay, Market to Cash and Employee Financial Services.To realize our ambition, we are looking for a Senior Financial Controller to strengthen our Financial Services Tax & Treasury team responsible for the Tax & Treasury accounting including its related processes. As Senior Financial Controller, you will bring hands-on and pragmatic expertise and know how to ensure the right accounting, coach more junior team members, actively engage in stakeholder management and drive continuous process improvements as well support the transition to our future ERP system. Furthermore, the Senior Financial Controller will be a key business partner to the Expert Tax Advisory team who focuses on technical tax requirements withing the ASML Group.It is a challenging position in a dynamic and international oriented environment. You support the team in its transformation to deliver world class end to end Record-To-Report process that ensures (external) tax compliance and supports accounting for (better) decision making.Another part of this role is providing support to the Tax technology roadmap. ASML strives to use technology as a driver to realize a fully automated and future proof (compliance) process. With technology, you can think of a direct tax engine, a direct tax compliance tool, a data-analytics tool, continuous monitoring, etc.Role And ResponsibilitiesKey areas of responsibilityManage worldwide ASML tax line calculation (including uncertain tax positions, deferred tax, return to provision/prior year tax adjustments, other discrete tax items etc.)Making sure our US GAAP & IFRS reporting packages reflect the right tax expense & tax balancesForecasting effective tax rate & relating tax balancesReview & manage income tax compliance withing Europe including our Dutch fiscal unityContinuous improvements of process and proceduresWhat makes this role interestingInformal team of young professionals & work environment where you are supported to put together creative solutions and improvementsInteraction with the Tax expertise team on relevant business events impacting our environment including working on several projectsUnique opportunity to gain insight in all other financial services processes (sales, inventory, fixed assets, consolidation) in order to ensure being compliantEducation and experienceMaster’s degree in AccountingFluent in English, Dutch is a big plus 6-10 years’ experience in (internationally oriented) comparable positions and/ or Big four experience; ideally coming from an (assistant) manager positionKnowledge and experience of applicable (tax) accounting rules (US GAAP and/or IFRS) SkillsWorking at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:Good analytical, communication, and social skills. Professional and ambitious attitude. IntroductionIn a nutshellLocationVeldhoven, NetherlandsTeamHRWork Experience8+ yearsJob CategoryOther job categoriesTravelNoHR Netherlands & EuropeThe HR Netherlands and HR Europe teams are responsible for steering and executing the people agendas for the Netherlands and for the countries in Europe* in close alignment with HR Line and Global HR expertise. The teams operate in a matrix structure and bring together HR Line / HR Expertise on country / region level.We follow the Global People Vision and People Strategy. We empower each other to thrive, fueling our growth, happiness & business success. The key pillars of our strategy are: inspire a unified culture, provide the best possible employee experience and enable our leadership to bring out the best in people.As country / regional HR team we drive sustainable employership by developing, defining, implementing & safeguarding people policies for the Netherlands and Europe that enable an engaged & happy workforce. We are within the global matrix organization accountable for labor (employee) relations, labor conditions, labor market and labor law.Purpose of the jobThe Talent & Learning Manager – HR NL & EU understands the integrated business talent challenges on country level for Netherlands and Europe. Focus is on overarching development priorities whereas “Run of the mill” capability-building and supply is led by the Academies that are part of the global learning and knowledge management organization. This a matrix role that collaborates on integrated solutions for the countries with the Talent Management Team and Academies connecting, integrating and synchronizing local deployment. The position acts also as learning business partner for more country specific learning & development needs. In Netherlands the position has co-ownership for the ‘Soft Policies’ that are part of our (Integrated) Talent Management Program (e.g. Internal Mobility, Develop & Perform).Position in the organizationThe position is a coordinating and integration position and is a member of the HR NL, HR EU country/region teams and the global Talent & Learning team. The Talent & Learning Manager – HR NL & EU is based in Veldhoven Netherlands and reports to the Head HR NL & EU and functional to the Head of Talent Management and the Head Learning & Knowledge Management.Areas of responsibility Represent NL & EU countries in global programs and support integration with overall planning on all initiatives touching talent management and learning in collaboration with Academy Leads and CoEsConsolidating demand / requirements from the country on (I)TM & L&D.Define & prioritize local cross-sector T&L topics together with HR Line and Country team.Input to global on strategic needs for programs/services requiring ITM and L&D Co-ownership for (Integrated) Talent Management ‘soft policies’ in Netherlands & EuropeCoordination and alignment of ITM program and country specific initiatives (eg sustainable employment / internal mobility)Coordinate and execute follow up on NL specific Talent Management processes relative to but not limited to Internal mobility, Performance Appeal, [email protected] (engagement)Alignment of (I)TMand Soft policies & process with labor relations if applicable (i.e. Work council)Build local competence on a need base. Drive Talent Management practice in the countryDrive country level consolidation/analysis for Talent & Succession.Identify need for talent / succession pools, priorities in people plan related to talent management.Learning & Development Business Partner for Netherlands and EU (excluding ASML Berlin) with focus on non – sector specific academies / colleges.Coordinate & Orchestrate program demand and synchronize deployment in country for topics such as but not limited to well-being, hybrid working solutions, diversity and inclusion.Bring T&L knowledge & expertise to country / region the table.Key requirementsExperience: >10 years’ of HR experience in international matrix organization with in depth HR expertise in the following subjects:Consulting / HR Business partneringTalent ManagementProject & Change ManagementKey competencesConsulting agilityInfluence without powerStrategic & Integrative thinkingSolution designExcellent in planning, scoping & organizing.Bridge building: dealing with diverse stakeholdersFlexible and can adapt to changeCan balance between working with an operational, tactical and strategic mind-set Diversity & InclusionASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. IntroductionAfter a system is shipped to a customer abroad, the real ‘magic’ begins. Thousands of engineers worldwide are dedicated to this one goal: making sure that the lithography systems at our customers’ sites are running smoothly, 24/7. That makes the Customer Support (CS) department vital to our success. The expectation from ASML’s customers is a continuous improvement of the added value of delivered services and optimization of costs. To support the rapid growth of our business we need to introduce standardized processes and supporting IT-systems. To realize those challenging goals, a strong portfolio and project management organization is required.Job DescriptionAs our Installed base business will be doubling in the coming 5 years, we are looking for a Business Program Manager to execute programs to enable the business for this growth. You as a PM will lead a business priority program to fulfill the strategy that is outlined to realize the business goals set. The Business Program Manager uses his/her deep knowledge to execute CS wide Business Improvement Projects by using best-practices of ASML and/or broad experience in similar industries together with proven Program Management and Change Management skills. These programs run from the roadmap driven concept phase to the embedding of the improvement in the standard CS daily operation.As program manager or Chief Product Owner you are responsible for realization of strategic business improvements for an assigned capability. This typically requires a multi-year program, involvement of several sectors, impacting >60 sites globally. You organize the program governance, you define the program roadmap and initiate the workstreams that design, deliver and implement the required deliverables and ensure business value.Both program manager and Chief Product Owner are responsible for an assigned business capability. A Chief Product Owner operates within the governance of a SAFe/Agile organization, a program manager organizes his/her own governance. To be successful you need to have a broad skillset:Business leader; you shape and drive the improvements needed to realize the strategic benefits for your program, in close collaboration with the business owner and sponsor group Stakeholder manager; you align the various stakeholders within sectors and regions and effectively address a broad range of interests.Organization skills; you structure, plan and manage a layered project organization.People management required to steer, motivate and coach your teams Collaboration with central & local business management as well as other disciplines and change initiatives is key to your success.Who are you?EducationMaster degree in business administration, industrial engineering or technical areaExperienceA combination of 2 or more of the following experience area’s:Over 8 year of Program Management experience, preferably combined with relevant experience in managing and implementing change in large, decentralized organizations;Over 8 years of business experience in different roles in a Customer Support or similar environment including operational responsibilities and with a clear process improvement mindset;Over 5 years’ experience with culture change and the soft aspects/people aspects of organizational development;Extensive experience in ASML is an explicit advantage;Over 5 years of experience in Agile WoW is an advantage;Additional job-related knowledge and/or managerial experience: operational (hands-on) experience in Service, Logistics, (Lean) manufacturing and/or industrial engineering environment, (senior) line management roles in operations, knowledge of financial management;Experience in consultancy in high-tech and/or service environments. Personal SkillsWorking at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.Excellent communication skills;High level of interpersonal and organizational sensitivity;Empathy, ability to “read” people: understand values and motives that drive behavior;Excellent ability to thrive in a multi-cultural environment with a global footprint;Seniority, in interpersonal sense and business knowledge;Flexibility, adapt to company culture and individual behavior;Ability to work from a broad scope, integrating people, processes, capabilities, technologies, and the details at the same time;Goal oriented, is motivated by realizing goals and by implementing effective change rather than personal acknowledgement;Ability to create and maintain a large trusted network on all levels of the organization;Able to convince, inspire and motivate people;Able to cooperate with people of different departments and levels within the ASML organization;Continuous Improvement & Process oriented mindset;Self-starter with drive, enthusiasm and persistence. Diversity & InclusionASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.Other InformationThe holder of this position reports to the Head of CS Business Performance Improvement Programs. He or she has interfaces to New Product Introduction program management, CS IT program management, regional CS organizations, CS Supporting departments, CS Service Architects,CS senior management team, CS finance, CS HR and Business Lines Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

IntroductionIntroduction to the jobDo you take a leading role in HR&O challenges? Ensuring a smooth HR&O cycle and contributing to topics like leadership development and organizational change? And do you want to be part of a fun and professional HR&O team? Then take the next step in your career and apply today!Role and responsibilitiesAs an HR Business Partner you work closely together with employees and management and provide them with solid advice and feedback on HR topics: You drive, support and advice in the yearly HR cycle regarding performance management, employee development, succession management & compensation. Furthermore, you contribute to realize our global HR&O priorities, focusing on Leadership & Competence development, Organization & Change, Strengthen HR Core and Attract, Recruit & Onboard. Next to that you provide input and feedback in (global) HR projects, representing the needs of your departments.In this exciting position you will have multiple roles:As an Employee Champion, you coach and mentor employees and support their development. This also entails managing risks, ethics and safety and the Works Council relations.Being a Change Agent, you assist in change initiatives, enhance management development, facilitate workshops and trainings and design sector-specific academies.As an Operational Expert you will be the executing the HR cycle, support on Compensation & Benefits related topics and recruitment, and deliver the correct HR data and dashboards.Lastly, but definitely not least you are a Strategic partner: You drive strategic workforce plans and development and assist line managers in solving organizational, people- and change-related issues. Education and experienceYou have a Bachelor's or Master's Degree for example in HRM or organizational/business studies.You have at least 8 years of experience in the field of HR and have proven yourself as a partner to the business.You bring knowledge in the field of People Performance Management, Talent Management, Recruitment and operational expertise as well as strong knowledge of Dutch labor legislation.Speaking English fluently is a must. Personal skillsWorking at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems. To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:Excellent international communicator, convincing and emphatic;Customer oriented (providing swift, efficient and personal guidance to employees and managers);Well-developed analytical skills in combination with a very pragmatic and result-driven approach;Strong on organizational sensitivityPro-active in stakeholder management;You are a team player and at the same time able to work independently;Able to step out of your comfort zoneStrong personal leadership skills (able to reflect and learning agility and able to influence across different levels) Context of the positionThe sector Human Resource & Organization is responsible for the development and implementation of all activities concerning HR&O Resources, Compensation & Benefits, Organizational Development, Development & Learning and Information and Process Control. The sector employs over 700+ employees, with a team in Europe, the US and Asia.This vacancy is positioned in the D&E Performance & Integration Cluster, which is part of the Development & Engineering (D&E) sector in the ASML organization. With approximately 15,000 employees it is the largest sector within ASML. Engineers have a range of backgrounds including physics, electronics, mechatronics, software, mechanics, data analytics and more.The D&E Performance & Integration Cluster HR team supports the cluster organization (approx. 1800 employees) with 5 talented colleagues, and you will report to the Sr HR Business Partner.The office location is in Veldhoven. This is a full-time position (40 hours). Working part-time is an option in case you’re available for at least 32 hours.Interested? IntroductionIntroduction to the jobIf you have a passion for Project Management, Change Management and continuous improvement then this could be your next job!On-time market introduction of ASML’s newest technologies requires an amazing product, effective processes and efficient execution. It needs a continuous drive to improve to secure the efficiency, effectiveness and profitability of ASML’s business. We are optimizing the processes, tools and reports in which we manage the operational execution, by managing successful improvement projects delivering the solutions we need.Are you challenged by:managing and leading cross functional improvement projects?engaging internal customers and managing stakeholder expectations?creating what is needed, not necessarily what is asked?offering solutions to satisfy the demanding user community?continuously improving processes, tools and reports?defining and maintaining a way of working for implementing changes?working within a multi-disciplinary team?Then we are looking for you! IntroductionIntroduction to the jobIntroductionTogether with her customers and suppliers ASML is heading towards an interesting and challenging era growing today’s company into and beyond 20bE company, playing a crucial role in the semiconductor industry globally. Your job will be in an internationally focused, driven, dynamic, and deadline orientated environment.Are you challenged by contributing to our successful world-class finance department as a hands-on Senior Financial Controller? Do you have the passion and ability to improve and automate existing processes taking into account tax requirements? Why not join us?Job MissionAt ASML we constantly have to ensure that our people, processes and information enable us to realize our growth and meet our ambitious business objectives. Especially in an exciting era of automation, digitalization, robotics and data mining, enabling ASML’s future growth and its success.Recently ASML has launched its transformation towards Global Enabling Services (GES) to deliver world-class transactional & operational support services organized around End to End (E2E) processes. Finance and IT are the first movers soon expected to be followed by other services. Within Finance we have established the E2E cycles, Record to Report, Invoice to Pay, Market to Cash and Employee Financial Services.To realize our ambition, we are looking for a Senior Financial Controller to strengthen our Financial Services Tax & Treasury team responsible for the Tax & Treasury accounting including its related processes. As Senior Financial Controller, you will bring hands-on and pragmatic expertise and know how to ensure the right accounting, coach more junior team members, actively engage in stakeholder management and drive continuous process improvements as well support the transition to our future ERP system. Furthermore, the Senior Financial Controller will be a key business partner to the Expert Tax Advisory team who focuses on technical tax requirements withing the ASML Group.It is a challenging position in a dynamic and international oriented environment. You support the team in its transformation to deliver world class end to end Record-To-Report process that ensures (external) tax compliance and supports accounting for (better) decision making.Another part of this role is providing support to the Tax technology roadmap. ASML strives to use technology as a driver to realize a fully automated and future proof (compliance) process. With technology, you can think of a direct tax engine, a direct tax compliance tool, a data-analytics tool, continuous monitoring, etc.Role And ResponsibilitiesKey areas of responsibilityManage worldwide ASML tax line calculation (including uncertain tax positions, deferred tax, return to provision/prior year tax adjustments, other discrete tax items etc.)Making sure our US GAAP & IFRS reporting packages reflect the right tax expense & tax balancesForecasting effective tax rate & relating tax balancesReview & manage income tax compliance withing Europe including our Dutch fiscal unityContinuous improvements of process and proceduresWhat makes this role interestingInformal team of young professionals & work environment where you are supported to put together creative solutions and improvementsInteraction with the Tax expertise team on relevant business events impacting our environment including working on several projectsUnique opportunity to gain insight in all other financial services processes (sales, inventory, fixed assets, consolidation) in order to ensure being compliantEducation and experienceMaster’s degree in AccountingFluent in English, Dutch is a big plus 6-10 years’ experience in (internationally oriented) comparable positions and/ or Big four experience; ideally coming from an (assistant) manager positionKnowledge and experience of applicable (tax) accounting rules (US GAAP and/or IFRS) SkillsWorking at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:Good analytical, communication, and social skills. Professional and ambitious attitude. Results oriented, team player who takes their responsibility seriouslyStrong understanding of financial accounting processesCapable of co-working with team members while maintaining higher level overviewAbility to build relationships with colleagues in other regions (US & Asia Diversity & InclusionASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. IntroductionIn a nutshellLocationVeldhoven, NetherlandsTeamSourcing & Supply ChainWork Experience3-7 yearsJob CategoryLogistics & supply chain managementTravel10%SummaryIn this role, you work for the Product Lifecycle Management department (within Sourcing & Supply Chain department) as part of a cross-departmental R&D team. This means you’ll be balancing a broad range of stakeholders both from within your cross-functional project team and from the supply chain management department. You’ll be supporting technology-driven development projects by finding creative supply chain solutions that not only meet your stakeholders needs but also help bring the supply chain management department to the next level.If you are ready for a second or third step in your career in the Supply Chain sector, this role would be perfect for you!Job ResponsibilitiesThe parts life cycle management department prides itself on its tight collaboration with other departments and teams across the company, and for securing material availability without fail. Specific responsibilities for this role include:Creating a project plan and maintaining it Incorporating logistics requirements into designs Ordering materials in order to ensure availability Conducting logistics risk analyses Securing and allocating financial resources for packaging and customer tooling Proactivelymanaging materials availability by making sure the bill of material (rawmaterials list) and technical product drawings required for a particularpart are available on schedule Creating transparent parts supply and demand schedules Creating decision sheets for late materials Determiningthe consequences that proposed plan changes have on the supply chainCreating,aligning, and monitoring implementation plans for engineering changes,while safeguarding the impact on material timing, cost and qualityContributingto the further development of the product life cycle management departmentEducationMSc in Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain / Logistics.ExperienceUp to 7 years of experience in planning, logistics processes and quality in a high-tech, low-volume environment, and in ramping up new productsExperience as a project engineer in a high-tech, low volume environment (e.g. supply chain engineering; production engineering)Experience in process development and IT-related process automationExperience in driving improvements Personal skillsResult-oriented skills Assertive, proactive problem solving skills Ensuring accountability Strong planning and alignment skillsSocial and communication skills Stakeholder management Customer focus Persuasion skills Collaboration; team player orientation Able to manage ambiguity ResiliencePeople are our single most valuable asset. In product life cycle management, our management team works with our project coordinators to help develop both their hard and soft skills through dedicated training programs. We keep an eye on their progress through a transparent training matrix dashboard.Working environmentA total of 100> people currently work in the Product Lifecycle Management department, divided over four business lines. You’ll be part of a team of 8–12 project coordinators, headed by a team lead, who will guide your personal development and oversee the development of processes within their team. Your team lead reports to a group leader, who in turn reports to the department director. The department’s other two teams include one team of operationally-focused product life cycle management project leaders, and one team of strategically-focused supply chain management project leaders.MeetingsBeing ‘in the middle’ between R&D teams and supply chain management means you’ll spend a significant amount of time in meetings with various stakeholders. You can expect to be a part of the following types of meetings:Development and engineering (R&D) project meetings;Calls with suppliers to align on materials availability and planning;‘Escalation’ meetings as part of a ‘tiger team’ managing urgent materials issues;Alignment meetings with system integration teams and production planning teams to discuss challenges in building prototypes and pilots;Alignment meetings to manage engineering changes related to introducing new materials in our supply chain, factories and customer locations.StakeholdersInner circle: team leaders and project managers from both product life cycle management and supply chain management.Middle circle: R&D project managers, supplier quality engineers, manufacturing engineers, customer support engineers and supply coordinators.Outer circle: configuration change specialists, sourcing leads, purchasers, logistics supply managers and field modification planners.Read what other parts life cycle management project coordinators have to say:Mei-Jhi (age 28): “What I like about my job as project coordinator is that every day is different from the day before – there’s a lot of variety in this function and that keeps this job interesting. I also love working within the product life cycle management because I instantly felt very welcome within the department.”Pien van Nistelrooij, (age 23): "There’s a lot of dynamics in the daily work. You work with multiple disciplines which enables you to have an all-round view on ASML organization and processes. As a PLM PC you are responsible for material availability, as from the very first stage when R&D starts to create technical product documentation." Meer weergeven Minder weergeven
