IntroductionIntroduction to the jobThe core values of ASML are Challenge, Collaborate and Care. We are proud of who we are, of our achievements, and how we accomplish these achievements. And, above all, we are one of the leading providers of lithography systems for the semiconductor industry. The employees of ASML share a passion for technology with a customer focus. At ASML one works continuously on the development and implementation of complex and high-quality technological systems. Working at ASML is therefore challenging and dynamic.Within ASML the sector Development & Engineering (D&E) is responsible for the design and specifications of ASML’s products. The department System Integration is part of D&E and responsible to manage risk during the integration phase of our products. Proto systems are used to verify the design concept at system level, which includes hardware and software.For the first time in ASML history will be perform System Integration outside ASML’s cleanroom. Around mid-2023 one of the Proto Integration systems will be relocated to Imec (Leuven-BE). This system will stay there for at least 2 years.Role And ResponsibilitiesAs a Proto Engineer EUV 24x7 you are responsible for the execution of the daily plan created by the Proto Integrator to support D&E project with their tests to validate the design at IMEC (Leuven – Belgium).You are responsible for:Safety and wellbeing Ensuring safe working environment and work according 5S principles.Quality is our habit Keeping the assigned machines in perfect state, i.e., hard and software, configuration up to date and well-functioning.Drive integration Ensuring efficient and effective integration activities on the machines, by Execute test plans on the machine in a most efficient way; Escalate in case problems cannot be solved by yourself; Provide technical support to D&E engineers; Review and prepare test plans.Determining whether issues are related to new design or proto system and solve and report the issues.Challenge, collaborate and care Proto integration is where things comes together. The product, the process, the people. Your behavior is therefore crucial to ensure we will reach our goals together in the end!Daily interface consist of Proto Engineers, Proto Integrator, System Test Engineer, Proto Configuration Engineer, D&E projects and the local IMEC team. In this role you will report to your local team manager and home group Lead.Education And ExperienceTechnical Bachelor (BsC/BEng) or Master (MSc) degree. Preferred fields of study: Physics, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics, Aerospace Engineering, Chemical Engineering.There are no constraints on working experience. The following items are a pre:Experience in a multi-disciplined and dynamic work environment.Knowledge of measurement systems and/or testing system functionality.Working with complex systems. SkillsWorking at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.We are looking for people with a strong personality and who will bring enthusiasm and flexibility into their job on a daily basis. It is unique that ASML is doing integration work outside ASML premises. Therefore, we expect people to be:Capable to communicate on all levels. So internal and external (Imec) stakeholders.Ensure a strong connection with their Veldhoven stakeholders.Proactive attitude with an autonomous mindset.Open to support CS when priority allows.The power to defend your own opinion.Willingness to invest in personal development. Diversity & InclusionASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.Other InformationThe vacancy Proto engineer EUV 24x7, means that you will be working on shifts.Work schedule in 10-day cycle:2 days Morning shift: 6:00 - 14:302 days Evening shift: 14:00 - 22:302 days Night shift: 22:00 - 06:304 days offOn top of the inconvenience allowance for working in shifts you will be receiving Business Travel Plus benefits for your allocation in Belgium.Candidates need to commit for at least 2-year allocation at Imec. Occasional travel to Veldhoven could be involved.This position requires access to U.S. controlled technology, as defined in the United States Export Administration Regulations. Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such U.S. controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with applicants who are immediately eligible to access U.S. controlled technology.Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? IntroductionIn a nutshellLocationVeldhoven, NetherlandsTeamHRWork Experience8+ yearsJob CategoryOther job categoriesTravelNoHR Netherlands & EuropeThe HR Netherlands and HR Europe teams are responsible for steering and executing the people agendas for the Netherlands and for the countries in Europe* in close alignment with HR Line and Global HR expertise. The teams operate in a matrix structure and bring together HR Line / HR Expertise on country / region level.We follow the Global People Vision and People Strategy. We empower each other to thrive, fueling our growth, happiness & business success. The key pillars of our strategy are: inspire a unified culture, provide the best possible employee experience and enable our leadership to bring out the best in people.As country / regional HR team we drive sustainable employership by developing, defining, implementing & safeguarding people policies for the Netherlands and Europe that enable an engaged & happy workforce. We are within the global matrix organization accountable for labor (employee) relations, labor conditions, labor market and labor law.Purpose of the jobThe Talent & Learning Manager – HR NL & EU understands the integrated business talent challenges on country level for Netherlands and Europe. Focus is on overarching development priorities whereas “Run of the mill” capability-building and supply is led by the Academies that are part of the global learning and knowledge management organization. This a matrix role that collaborates on integrated solutions for the countries with the Talent Management Team and Academies connecting, integrating and synchronizing local deployment. The position acts also as learning business partner for more country specific learning & development needs. In Netherlands the position has co-ownership for the ‘Soft Policies’ that are part of our (Integrated) Talent Management Program (e.g. Internal Mobility, Develop & Perform).Position in the organizationThe position is a coordinating and integration position and is a member of the HR NL, HR EU country/region teams and the global Talent & Learning team. The Talent & Learning Manager – HR NL & EU is based in Veldhoven Netherlands and reports to the Head HR NL & EU and functional to the Head of Talent Management and the Head Learning & Knowledge Management.Areas of responsibility Represent NL & EU countries in global programs and support integration with overall planning on all initiatives touching talent management and learning in collaboration with Academy Leads and CoEsConsolidating demand / requirements from the country on (I)TM & L&D.Define & prioritize local cross-sector T&L topics together with HR Line and Country team.Input to global on strategic needs for programs/services requiring ITM and L&D Co-ownership for (Integrated) Talent Management ‘soft policies’ in Netherlands & EuropeCoordination and alignment of ITM program and country specific initiatives (eg sustainable employment / internal mobility)Coordinate and execute follow up on NL specific Talent Management processes relative to but not limited to Internal mobility, Performance Appeal, [email protected] (engagement)Alignment of (I)TMand Soft policies & process with labor relations if applicable (i.e. Work council)Build local competence on a need base. Drive Talent Management practice in the countryDrive country level consolidation/analysis for Talent & Succession.Identify need for talent / succession pools, priorities in people plan related to talent management.Learning & Development Business Partner for Netherlands and EU (excluding ASML Berlin) with focus on non – sector specific academies / colleges.Coordinate & Orchestrate program demand and synchronize deployment in country for topics such as but not limited to well-being, hybrid working solutions, diversity and inclusion.Bring T&L knowledge & expertise to country / region the table.Key requirementsExperience: >10 years’ of HR experience in international matrix organization with in depth HR expertise in the following subjects:Consulting / HR Business partneringTalent ManagementProject & Change ManagementKey competencesConsulting agilityInfluence without powerStrategic & Integrative thinkingSolution designExcellent in planning, scoping & organizing.Bridge building: dealing with diverse stakeholdersFlexible and can adapt to changeCan balance between working with an operational, tactical and strategic mind-set Diversity & InclusionASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company. EU covers Belgium, France, Germany (excluding ASML Berlin factory) Ireland, Italy, UK and Israel. IntroductionIntroduction to the jobAre you challenged by a supply chain over 7 tiers deep? Do you want to contribute solving the worlds chip shortage and deliver input for ASML’s supplier strategy? If so, we should talk!ASML is looking for a Logistics Supplier Manager with experience in a manufacturing supply chain environment. Building, developing and creating improvements to drive operational excellence at our suppliers and represent the supplier towards our internal stakeholders and customers will be the main responsibilities within this position. Together we help to build the most amazing, complex machines that you will ever see. Watch the video to learn more: ASML IN 1 MINUTERole And ResponsibilitiesAs a Logistics Supplier Manager, you are responsible to drive Logistics Management and Operational Performance of a selected number of key suppliers in the ASML Logistics supply chain. The continuously increasing business demands make this a challenge. You’ll work to provide a reliable, responsive and robust global supply chain network which delivers materials to the factory and the field at the right moment, in the right quantity and quality against the lowest integral costs.Your main responsibilities as a Logistics Supplier Manager are: SkillsDrive Operational Excellence Performance at suppliers and their n-tier suppliers, securing 95% on-time delivery performance to ASML.Securing sufficient capacity at your suppliers to facilitate the ASML growth.Optimize manufacturing processes at suppliers to own and drive material availability crisis to a successful outcome.Represent Logistics as member of Supplier Account Team.Lead a cross sectoral team for several projects.Work with ASML stakeholders to shape our future supply chain.Drive process improvements at suppliers; actively participating in improvement projects at suppliers.Education and experience To help us tackle the challenges we face, you have:A master’s or bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management or similar.10+ years relevant work experience in similar roles with international scope or in a production logistics environment.Experience in improvement & operational excellence in manufacturing / supply chain environment.Experience in (supplier-) account management.Experience in High tech, low volume industries is a pre.Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve. To further thrive as a Logistics Supplier Manager, you need the following skills:Excellent stakeholder management and relationship building skills.Analytical and conceptual thinker on strategic level.Pragmatic and result driven.Managing ambiguity.Pro-active attitude, drive for improvement.Flexible and adaptable.What do we offer?The role of Logistics Supplier Manager offers a unique and challenging job in which you have many opportunities of growth within your supply chain career. You’ll receive a fulltime and permanent job with continuous training to develop yourself. For more information you can read ASML’s labor conditions and development opportunities .Want to know more about applying for a job at ASML? IntroductionIntroduction to the jobDo you take a leading role in HR&O challenges? Ensuring a smooth HR&O cycle and contributing to topics like leadership development and organizational change? And do you want to be part of a fun and professional HR&O team? Then take the next step in your career and apply today!Role and responsibilitiesAs an HR Business Partner you work closely together with employees and management and provide them with solid advice and feedback on HR topics: You drive, support and advice in the yearly HR cycle regarding performance management, employee development, succession management & compensation. Furthermore, you contribute to realize our global HR&O priorities, focusing on Leadership & Competence development, Organization & Change, Strengthen HR Core and Attract, Recruit & Onboard. Next to that you provide input and feedback in (global) HR projects, representing the needs of your departments.In this exciting position you will have multiple roles:As an Employee Champion, you coach and mentor employees and support their development. This also entails managing risks, ethics and safety and the Works Council relations.Being a Change Agent, you assist in change initiatives, enhance management development, facilitate workshops and trainings and design sector-specific academies.As an Operational Expert you will be the executing the HR cycle, support on Compensation & Benefits related topics and recruitment, and deliver the correct HR data and dashboards.Lastly, but definitely not least you are a Strategic partner: You drive strategic workforce plans and development and assist line managers in solving organizational, people- and change-related issues. Education and experienceYou have a Bachelor's or Master's Degree for example in HRM or organizational/business studies.You have at least 8 years of experience in the field of HR and have proven yourself as a partner to the business.You bring knowledge in the field of People Performance Management, Talent Management, Recruitment and operational expertise as well as strong knowledge of Dutch labor legislation.Speaking English fluently is a must. Personal skillsWorking at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems. To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:Excellent international communicator, convincing and emphatic;Customer oriented (providing swift, efficient and personal guidance to employees and managers);Well-developed analytical skills in combination with a very pragmatic and result-driven approach;Strong on organizational sensitivityPro-active in stakeholder management;You are a team player and at the same time able to work independently;Able to step out of your comfort zoneStrong personal leadership skills (able to reflect and learning agility and able to influence across different levels) Context of the positionThe sector Human Resource & Organization is responsible for the development and implementation of all activities concerning HR&O Resources, Compensation & Benefits, Organizational Development, Development & Learning and Information and Process Control. The sector employs over 700+ employees, with a team in Europe, the US and Asia.This vacancy is positioned in the D&E Performance & Integration Cluster, which is part of the Development & Engineering (D&E) sector in the ASML organization. With approximately 15,000 employees it is the largest sector within ASML. Engineers have a range of backgrounds including physics, electronics, mechatronics, software, mechanics, data analytics and more.The D&E Performance & Integration Cluster HR team supports the cluster organization (approx. 1800 employees) with 5 talented colleagues, and you will report to the Sr HR Business Partner.The office location is in Veldhoven. This is a full-time position (40 hours). Working part-time is an option in case you’re available for at least 32 hours.Interested? Please apply with your (English) CV and cover letter, detailing your motivation for this specific role.Diversity & InclusionASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. IntroductionIntroduction to the jobAs the Supply Planning Product Owner you are the business partner for supply chain planning that connects with the Agile solutions team.Within this role, you are the business representative for the products and services that the DevOps team delivers. IntroductionAre you keen to take up a new challenge in a global fast growing company? Are you looking for a next step in your career and would enjoy enabling ASML business to achieve its objectives while being in control?We are looking for a professional who makes the difference because it’s in your nature to standardize, simplify and automate to ensure E2E business processes are in control.Job MissionAt ASML we constantly have to ensure that our people, processes and information enable us to realize our growth and meet our ambitious business objectives. Especially in an exciting era of automation, digitalization, robotics and data mining, enabling ASML’s future growth and its success.Recently ASML has launched its transformation towards Global Enabling Services (GES) to deliver world-class transactional & operational support services organized around End to End (E2E) processes. Finance and IT are the first movers soon expected to be followed by other services. Within Finance we have established the E2E cycles, Record to Report, Invoice to Pay, Market to Cash and Employee Financial Services.To realize our ambition we are looking for a Senior Financial Controller to strengthen our Financial Services team responsible for the accounting related to a.o. Opex, Capex, inventory and manufacturing including its related processes.As Senior Financial Controller, you will bring hands-on and pragmatic expertise and know how to ensure the right accounting, coach more junior team members, actively engage in stakeholder management and drive continuous process improvements as well support the transition to our future ERP system.It is a challenging position in a dynamic and international oriented environment. You support the team in its transformation to deliver world class end to end Record-To-Report process that ensures (external) compliance and supports management accounting for (better) decision making.Team responsibilityTogether with the team you are responsible to:Ensure appropriate accounting (USGAAP, IFRS & local statutory),Drive improvement initiatives related to Record to Report processes and reports,Drive compliancy and perform internal (SOx) control activities,Perform accounting assessments,Key user processes and systems.What makes this role interestingBe part of a highly motivated team that has a relentless focus on process optimization and automation.Face demanding challenges and enjoy the freedom to put together creative solutions.You interact with all layers in a demanding and busy technology driven organizationPosition in the organizationThe Senior Financial Controller – Financial Services General Accounting is part of Financial Services Europe within Global Enabling Services. Financial Services is responsible for the ASML wide E2E accounting processes, supporting the business and providing management reporting as well as ensuring external compliance. He/she interacts with various departments and layers in and outside of finance.ExperienceYou have 8+ years relevant experience in finance or accounting preferably in a financial control or auditing environment supplemented with business experience.In addition, you have the following qualifications:A Master’s degree in Finance, Economics or Accounting supplemented with being a Chartered Accountant (CPA/RA) or Chartered Controller (EMFC/RC).Experience in working in an international, multinational environment.Experience in supervising, managing or coaching team members is a plusKnowledge of and experience with US GAAP and IFRS.Experience in process mapping and redesign including internal/SOx control set-up.Expert user in Microsoft Excel and experience in SAP.Affinity with BI and RPA (preferred but not required). Personal skillsResult oriented, team player, with excellent analytical skills, critical thinking, proactive and communicative personality who can connect with all layers in a demanding and very busy technology driven organization. Other important skills are:Multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural understanding Committed and flexible (go the extra mile)Fluent in English (written and spoken)Has integrity and is compliance-mindedStrives for continuous improvement. The Strategic Sourcing Project Manager uses his/her strategic and analytical capabilities along with his/her excellent stakeholder management skills to develop the sourcing strategy that prolongs AMSL’s amazing business performance.Role And ResponsibilitiesThe Strategic Sourcing Project Manager is responsible for:making make-buy proposals on new products and new technologies for decision in the executive committee of ASML. develop the supply strategy for areas such as Optics, Mechatronics & Mechanics and Electrical Sourcing together with the responsible Category manager and all cross-sector stakeholders: Technology, Operations, Finance and Legal.This includes: landscaping the supply base, creating early supplier involvement in development projects balancing long-term supply capacity with expected market requirements, prevents strategic lock-ins, optimizes deal structures to maximize ASML’s Total Cost of Ownership, and scouts new suppliers. IntroductionIntroduction to the jobIntroductionTogether with her customers and suppliers ASML is heading towards an interesting and challenging era growing today’s company into and beyond 20bE company, playing a crucial role in the semiconductor industry globally. Your job will be in an internationally focused, driven, dynamic, and deadline orientated environment.Are you challenged by contributing to our successful world-class finance department as a hands-on Senior Financial Controller? Do you have the passion and ability to improve and automate existing processes taking into account tax requirements? Why not join us?Job MissionAt ASML we constantly have to ensure that our people, processes and information enable us to realize our growth and meet our ambitious business objectives. Especially in an exciting era of automation, digitalization, robotics and data mining, enabling ASML’s future growth and its success.Recently ASML has launched its transformation towards Global Enabling Services (GES) to deliver world-class transactional & operational support services organized around End to End (E2E) processes. Finance and IT are the first movers soon expected to be followed by other services. Within Finance we have established the E2E cycles, Record to Report, Invoice to Pay, Market to Cash and Employee Financial Services.To realize our ambition, we are looking for a Senior Financial Controller to strengthen our Financial Services Tax & Treasury team responsible for the Tax & Treasury accounting including its related processes. As Senior Financial Controller, you will bring hands-on and pragmatic expertise and know how to ensure the right accounting, coach more junior team members, actively engage in stakeholder management and drive continuous process improvements as well support the transition to our future ERP system. Furthermore, the Senior Financial Controller will be a key business partner to the Expert Tax Advisory team who focuses on technical tax requirements withing the ASML Group.It is a challenging position in a dynamic and international oriented environment. You support the team in its transformation to deliver world class end to end Record-To-Report process that ensures (external) tax compliance and supports accounting for (better) decision making.Another part of this role is providing support to the Tax technology roadmap. ASML strives to use technology as a driver to realize a fully automated and future proof (compliance) process. With technology, you can think of a direct tax engine, a direct tax compliance tool, a data-analytics tool, continuous monitoring, etc.Role And ResponsibilitiesKey areas of responsibilityManage worldwide ASML tax line calculation (including uncertain tax positions, deferred tax, return to provision/prior year tax adjustments, other discrete tax items etc.)Making sure our US GAAP & IFRS reporting packages reflect the right tax expense & tax balancesForecasting effective tax rate & relating tax balancesReview & manage income tax compliance withing Europe including our Dutch fiscal unityContinuous improvements of process and proceduresWhat makes this role interestingInformal team of young professionals & work environment where you are supported to put together creative solutions and improvementsInteraction with the Tax expertise team on relevant business events impacting our environment including working on several projectsUnique opportunity to gain insight in all other financial services processes (sales, inventory, fixed assets, consolidation) in order to ensure being compliantEducation and experienceMaster’s degree in AccountingFluent in English, Dutch is a big plus 6-10 years’ experience in (internationally oriented) comparable positions and/ or Big four experience; ideally coming from an (assistant) manager positionKnowledge and experience of applicable (tax) accounting rules (US GAAP and/or IFRS) SkillsWorking at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:Good analytical, communication, and social skills. Professional and ambitious attitude. Results oriented, team player who takes their responsibility seriouslyStrong understanding of financial accounting processesCapable of co-working with team members while maintaining higher level overviewAbility to build relationships with colleagues in other regions (US & Asia Diversity & InclusionASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.Other InformationAre you interested in this role? IntroductionAre you keen to take up a new challenge in a global fast growing company? Are you looking for a next step in your career and would enjoy enabling ASML business to achieve its objectives while being in control?We are looking for you: A professional who makes the difference because it’s in your nature to standardize, simplify and automate to ensure E2E business processes are in control.Job MissionAt ASML we constantly have to ensure that our people, processes and information enable us to realize our growth and meet our ambitious business objectives. Especially in an exciting era of automation, digitalization, robotics and data mining, enabling ASML’s future growth and its success.Recently ASML has launched its transformation towards Global Enabling Services (GES) to deliver world-class transactional & operational support services organized around End to End (E2E) processes. Finance and IT are the first movers soon expected to be followed by other services. Within Finance we have established the E2E cycles, Record to Report, Invoice to Pay, Market to Cash and Employee Financial Services.To realize our ambition we are looking for a Senior Financial Controller to strengthen our Financial Services General team responsible for the Opex and Capex accounting including its related processes. As Senior Financial Controller, you will bring hands-on and pragmatic expertise and know how to ensure the right accounting, coach more junior team members, actively engage in stakeholder management and drive continuous process improvements as well support the transition to our future ERP system.It is a challenging position in a dynamic and international oriented environment. You support the team in its transformation to deliver world class end to end Record-To-Report process that ensures (external) compliance and supports management accounting for (better) decision making. Team responsibilityTogether with the team you are responsible to:Ensure appropriate accounting (USGAAP, IFRS & local statutory),Drive improvement initiatives related to Record to Report processes and reports,Drive compliancy and perform internal (SOx) control activities,Perform accounting assessments,Key user for Opex and Capex processes and systems. What makes this role interestingBe part of a highly motivated team that has a relentless focus on process optimization and automation.Face demanding challenges and enjoy the freedom to put together creative solutions.You interact with all layers in a demanding and busy technology driven organization. Position in the organizationThe Senior Financial Controller – Financial Services General Accounting is part of Financial Services Europe within Global Enabling Services. Financial Services is responsible for the ASML wide E2E accounting processes, supporting the business and providing management reporting as well as ensuring external compliance. The Senior Financial Controller - Financial Services General Accounting, reports to the Manager Financial Services General accounting. He/she interacts with various departments and layers in and outside of finance.ExperienceYou have 8+ years relevant experience in finance or accounting preferably in a financial control or auditing environment.In addition, you have the following qualifications:A Master’s degree in Finance, Economics or Accounting supplemented with being a Chartered Accountant (CPA/RA) or Controller (RC).Experience in working in an international, multinational environment.Knowledge and experience with US GAAP and IFRS.Experience in process mapping and redesign including internal control set-up.Expert user in Microsoft Excel and experience in SAP.Affinity with BI and RPA (preferred but not required). Personal skillsResult oriented, team player, with excellent analytical skills, critical thinking, proactive and communicative personality who can connect with all layers in a demanding and very busy technology driven organization. Other important skills are:Multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural understanding, Committed and flexible (go the extra mile),Fluent in English (written and spoken),Has integrity and is compliance-minded,Strives for continuous improvement. You support the team in its transformation to deliver world class end to end Record-To-Report process that ensures (external) compliance and supports management accounting for (better) decision making. IntroductionIntroduction to the jobAre you challenged by a supply chain over 7 tiers deep? Do you want to contribute solving the worlds chip shortage and deliver input for ASML’s supplier strategy? If so, we should talk!ASML is looking for a Logistics Supplier Manager with experience in a manufacturing supply chain environment. Building, developing and creating improvements to drive operational excellence at our suppliers and represent the supplier towards our internal stakeholders and customers will be the main responsibilities within this position. Together we help to build the most amazing, complex machines that you will ever see. Watch the video to learn more: ASML IN 1 MINUTERole And ResponsibilitiesAs a Logistics Supplier Manager, you are responsible to drive Logistics Management and Operational Performance of a selected number of key suppliers in the ASML Logistics supply chain. The continuously increasing business demands make this a challenge. You’ll work to provide a reliable, responsive and robust global supply chain network which delivers materials to the factory and the field at the right moment, in the right quantity and quality against the lowest integral costs.Your main responsibilities as a Logistics Supplier Manager are: SkillsDrive Operational Excellence Performance at suppliers and their n-tier suppliers, securing 95% on-time delivery performance to ASML.Securing sufficient capacity at your suppliers to facilitate the ASML growth.Optimize manufacturing processes at suppliers to own and drive material availability crisis to a successful outcome.Represent Logistics as member of Supplier Account Team.Lead a cross sectoral team for several projects.Work with ASML stakeholders to shape our future supply chain.Drive process improvements at suppliers; actively participating in improvement projects at suppliers.Education and experience To help us tackle the challenges we face, you have:A master’s or bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management or similar.10+ years relevant work experience in similar roles with international scope or in a production logistics environment.Experience in improvement & operational excellence in manufacturing / supply chain environment.Experience in (supplier-) account management.Experience in High tech, low volume industries is a pre.Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve. To further thrive as a Logistics Supplier Manager, you need the following skills:Excellent stakeholder management and relationship building skills.Analytical and conceptual thinker on strategic level.Pragmatic and result driven.Managing ambiguity.Pro-active attitude, drive for improvement.Flexible and adaptable.What do we offer?The role of Logistics Supplier Manager offers a unique and challenging job in which you have many opportunities of growth within your supply chain career. You’ll receive a fulltime and permanent job with continuous training to develop yourself. For more information you can read ASML’s labor conditions and development opportunities .Want to know more about applying for a job at ASML? IntroductionIntroduction to the jobASML is the world's leading provider of lithography systems for the semiconductor industry, manufacturing complex machines that are critical to the production of integrated circuits or chipsMulti e-Beam Inspection tools are part of ASML’s holistic lithography portfolio. ASML has an Electron Optical competence center in Delft with multi-disciplinary teams where we have combined Research with Development & Engineering.Job MissionASML Delft delivers modules and SEM systems for ASML’s multi e-beam inspection programs. As Quality Manager for you take responsibility for the definition, alignment and execution of the Quality strategy and roadmap within the ASML Delft department.Role And ResponsibilitiesAs Quality Manager you will: Define and align the department’s quality strategy as member of the department management staff. Execute and report on process improvement projects as part of the quality strategy at department level and/or sector level. Lead/participate in project teams in analyzing process gaps, identifying improvements, support implementation and securing consolidation within the department. Provide input from department into cluster and sector Quality roadmap and vice versa. Report on quality status, communicate quality message in groups and on department level. Improve transparency. Support and coach project teams and their engineers on the quality of technical solutions proposed and deliverables produced. Maintain and deploy department’s processes, providing regular reporting on process adherence to group leaders and project leaders. Facilitate lessons Learned in the various departmental groups and competences.Education and experience Master degree (M.Sc.) in Physics, Electronics or any other technical oriented study with relevant experience in the field of (technical) Quality Management. More than 8 years of work experience in technically-driven international organization(s), preferably within a development environment. Experience as quality manager. Experienced in quality methods and tools like e.g., 6 Sigma, value stream analysis, 5 Why’s analysis, Kaizen, brainstorming sessions, problem solving techniques, FMEA, 8D , Ishikawa diagrams. Knowledgeable in international quality standards. (ISO9001/14001/ TS16949), (development) process assessments and audits.SkillsWorking at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills: Ability to manage complex relationships between various professional disciplines and organizational levels. Excellent stakeholder management and team leader skills, able to collaborate across all levels of the organization with an open attitude. Excellent ability to manage change with the ability to overcome resistance and persist in achieving mission. Strong communication skills, good listener, with the ability to present information verbally and in written format. Self-propelling - learning & (Quality) improvement mindset and change management. Hands-on mentality to get the job done. Drive for continuous improvement; making use of the lessons learned. Strong analytical ability with a pragmatic attitude. Affinity with Agile work methods. Good communication skills and knowledge of English language.Diversity & InclusionASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.Other InformationContext of the positionThe mission of the Quality Cluster is to support and strengthen technology development by ensuring and improving Quality Control, reducing risks, driving Improvement and Assurance providing insight on D&E processes and deliverables with a predictable outcome. With a continuous growing demand for faster delivery of latest technology, good Quality and reliability becomes more and more challenging. This means that our processes must become more effective and efficient. We do this by monitoring and driving success, pro-actively ensuring product Quality (Quality control), securing process adherence and implement lessons learned (Quality assurance) and continuously improve our Way of Working (Quality improvement).The Quality Manager for AMSL Delft will directly report to the Cluster Quality Manager who is located in Veldhoven, and functionally to the Department manager in Delft. You will be located in Delft for 4 days a week. 1 day per week you will be in Veldhoven to secure/maintain your knowledge and competence on ASML Quality Management and to participate in the cluster quality group meeting.Please submit your resume and cover letter when applying for this position.This position requires access to U.S. controlled technology, as defined in the United States Export Administration Regulations. Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such U.S. controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with applicants who are immediately eligible to access U.S. controlled technology.Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? IntroductionIn a nutshellLocationVeldhoven, NetherlandsTeamSourcing & Supply ChainWork Experience3-7 yearsJob CategoryLogistics & supply chain managementTravel10%SummaryIn this role, you work for the Product Lifecycle Management department (within Sourcing & Supply Chain department) as part of a cross-departmental R&D team. This means you’ll be balancing a broad range of stakeholders both from within your cross-functional project team and from the supply chain management department. You’ll be supporting technology-driven development projects by finding creative supply chain solutions that not only meet your stakeholders needs but also help bring the supply chain management department to the next level.If you are ready for a second or third step in your career in the Supply Chain sector, this role would be perfect for you!Job ResponsibilitiesThe parts life cycle management department prides itself on its tight collaboration with other departments and teams across the company, and for securing material availability without fail. Specific responsibilities for this role include:Creating a project plan and maintaining it Incorporating logistics requirements into designs Ordering materials in order to ensure availability Conducting logistics risk analyses Securing and allocating financial resources for packaging and customer tooling Proactivelymanaging materials availability by making sure the bill of material (rawmaterials list) and technical product drawings required for a particularpart are available on schedule Creating transparent parts supply and demand schedules Creating decision sheets for late materials Determiningthe consequences that proposed plan changes have on the supply chainCreating,aligning, and monitoring implementation plans for engineering changes,while safeguarding the impact on material timing, cost and qualityContributingto the further development of the product life cycle management departmentEducationMSc in Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain / Logistics.ExperienceUp to 7 years of experience in planning, logistics processes and quality in a high-tech, low-volume environment, and in ramping up new productsExperience as a project engineer in a high-tech, low volume environment (e.g. supply chain engineering; production engineering)Experience in process development and IT-related process automationExperience in driving improvements Personal skillsResult-oriented skills Assertive, proactive problem solving skills Ensuring accountability Strong planning and alignment skillsSocial and communication skills Stakeholder management Customer focus Persuasion skills Collaboration; team player orientation Able to manage ambiguity ResiliencePeople are our single most valuable asset. In product life cycle management, our management team works with our project coordinators to help develop both their hard and soft skills through dedicated training programs. We keep an eye on their progress through a transparent training matrix dashboard.Working environmentA total of 100> people currently work in the Product Lifecycle Management department, divided over four business lines. You’ll be part of a team of 8–12 project coordinators, headed by a team lead, who will guide your personal development and oversee the development of processes within their team. Your team lead reports to a group leader, who in turn reports to the department director. The department’s other two teams include one team of operationally-focused product life cycle management project leaders, and one team of strategically-focused supply chain management project leaders.MeetingsBeing ‘in the middle’ between R&D teams and supply chain management means you’ll spend a significant amount of time in meetings with various stakeholders. You can expect to be a part of the following types of meetings:Development and engineering (R&D) project meetings;Calls with suppliers to align on materials availability and planning;‘Escalation’ meetings as part of a ‘tiger team’ managing urgent materials issues;Alignment meetings with system integration teams and production planning teams to discuss challenges in building prototypes and pilots;Alignment meetings to manage engineering changes related to introducing new materials in our supply chain, factories and customer locations.StakeholdersInner circle: team leaders and project managers from both product life cycle management and supply chain management.Middle circle: R&D project managers, supplier quality engineers, manufacturing engineers, customer support engineers and supply coordinators.Outer circle: configuration change specialists, sourcing leads, purchasers, logistics supply managers and field modification planners.Read what other parts life cycle management project coordinators have to say:Mei-Jhi (age 28): “What I like about my job as project coordinator is that every day is different from the day before – there’s a lot of variety in this function and that keeps this job interesting. I also love working within the product life cycle management because I instantly felt very welcome within the department.”Pien van Nistelrooij, (age 23): "There’s a lot of dynamics in the daily work. You work with multiple disciplines which enables you to have an all-round view on ASML organization and processes. As a PLM PC you are responsible for material availability, as from the very first stage when R&D starts to create technical product documentation." Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.This position requires access to U.S. controlled technology, as defined in the United States Export Administration Regulations. Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such U.S. controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with applicants who are immediately eligible to access U.S. controlled technology.Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? IntroductionAre you keen to take up a new challenge in a global fast growing company? Are you looking for a next step in your career and would enjoy enabling ASML business to achieve its objectives while being in control?We are looking for you: A professional who makes the difference because it’s in your nature to standardize, simplify and automate to ensure E2E business processes are in control.Job MissionAt ASML we constantly have to ensure that our people, processes and information enable us to realize our growth and meet our ambitious business objectives. Especially in an exciting era of automation, digitalization, robotics and data mining, enabling ASML’s future growth and its success.Recently ASML has launched its transformation towards Global Enabling Services (GES) to deliver world-class transactional & operational support services organized around End to End (E2E) processes. Finance and IT are the first movers soon expected to be followed by other services. Within Finance we have established the E2E cycles, Record to Report, Invoice to Pay, Market to Cash and Employee Financial Services.To realize our ambition we are looking for a Senior Financial Controller to strengthen our Financial Services General team responsible for the Opex and Capex accounting including its related processes. As Senior Financial Controller, you will bring hands-on and pragmatic expertise and know how to ensure the right accounting, coach more junior team members, actively engage in stakeholder management and drive continuous process improvements as well support the transition to our future ERP system.It is a challenging position in a dynamic and international oriented environment. You support the team in its transformation to deliver world class end to end Record-To-Report process that ensures (external) compliance and supports management accounting for (better) decision making. Team responsibilityTogether with the team you are responsible to:Ensure appropriate accounting (USGAAP, IFRS & local statutory),Drive improvement initiatives related to Record to Report processes and reports,Drive compliancy and perform internal (SOx) control activities,Perform accounting assessments,Key user for Opex and Capex processes and systems. What makes this role interestingBe part of a highly motivated team that has a relentless focus on process optimization and automation.Face demanding challenges and enjoy the freedom to put together creative solutions.You interact with all layers in a demanding and busy technology driven organization. Position in the organizationThe Senior Financial Controller – Financial Services General Accounting is part of Financial Services Europe within Global Enabling Services. Financial Services is responsible for the ASML wide E2E accounting processes, supporting the business and providing management reporting as well as ensuring external compliance. The Senior Financial Controller - Financial Services General Accounting, reports to the Manager Financial Services General accounting. He/she interacts with various departments and layers in and outside of finance.ExperienceYou have 8+ years relevant experience in finance or accounting preferably in a financial control or auditing environment.In addition, you have the following qualifications:A Master’s degree in Finance, Economics or Accounting supplemented with being a Chartered Accountant (CPA/RA) or Controller (RC).Experience in working in an international, multinational environment.Knowledge and experience with US GAAP and IFRS.Experience in process mapping and redesign including internal control set-up.Expert user in Microsoft Excel and experience in SAP.Affinity with BI and RPA (preferred but not required). Personal skillsResult oriented, team player, with excellent analytical skills, critical thinking, proactive and communicative personality who can connect with all layers in a demanding and very busy technology driven organization. Other important skills are:Multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural understanding, Committed and flexible (go the extra mile),Fluent in English (written and spoken),Has integrity and is compliance-minded,Strives for continuous improvement. Diversity & InclusionASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.Other InformationASML creates the conditions that enable you to realize your full potential. We provide state-of-the-art facilities, opportunities to develop your talents, international career opportunities, a stimulating and inspiring environment, and most of all, the commitment of a company that recognizes and rewards outstanding performance. Location Veldhoven, Netherlands.It is a challenging position in a dynamic and international oriented environment. You support the team in its transformation to deliver world class end to end Record-To-Report process that ensures (external) compliance and supports management accounting for (better) decision making. IntroductionIntroduction to the jobAre you keen to take up a new challenge in a global fast growing company? Are you looking for a next step in your career and would enjoy enabling ASML business to achieve its objectives while being in control?We are looking for you: A Senior Financial Controller Sales who is responsible for the accounting, analysis and monitoring relating to the sales activities within the Global Enabling Services – Financial Services (GES - FS) Systems & UF Sales department of ASML. You will act as liaison with other departments and stakeholders, ensure complaint, proper and timely financial administration and reporting in compliance with US GAAP, other local GAAP and IFRS revenue recognition guidance.The position is the linking-pin between the customer business controllers, local business controllers and the central revenue accounting & reporting department of ASML. It is a challenging position in a hectic, dynamic and international oriented environment with tight deadlines and direct impact on ASML’s financial results. A position with many growth opportunities within ASML.Role And ResponsibilitiesThe focus in this position is ensuring effective and efficient processing of financial transactions by team members. This needs to be done by:Continuous forward looking and making sure that all transactions are substantiated and can be explained (to all stakeholders internally and externally)Alignment with the business control counterpart ensuring that the planning will not deviate from the actual processingMonitoring complaint accountingContinuous balance monitoringWhat makes this role interestingInteraction with business: such as Business control and local sales controlA team that has a consistent drive from identifying and implementation of improvementsMain responsibilities:Together with the entire team, responsible for worldwide System and UF salesLiaise with Business control, local sales control and Accounting Experts throughout the execution of the contract to ensure proper revenue recognition in external reporting;First point of contact for external and internal auditors. Making sure the audits can be executed in a efficient and affective way.Ensure proper and timely execution of sales related accounting for ASML products (systems and options). Maintain and control related balance sheets;Collaborate within the GES FS team to identify, discuss and report exceptional transactions that need special attention. Monitor the execution, progress and balance positions related to volume price agreements using SAP, Spotfire, Mendix and SAPRAR tooling;Reviewing and interpretation of customer contracts to ensure compliance with US GAAP and IFRS revenue recognition guidance (ASC606 / IFRS15)Provide ad-hoc support for accounting related questionsProactively seek for continuous improvements in the execution of agreed performance and T&C’sEnsure accounting in an effective and efficient way in compliance with applicable laws and regulations;Develop and demonstrate strong understanding of the sales processes, reflected in the reports, analysis and commentaries provided;Proactively seek for continuous improvements in the execution of activities, improving efficiency and quality; Improving (automating), execution and documentation of internal control framework and SOX controls for the applicable processes. Education and experienceAcademic degree in Finance and/or Business Economics. RA degree is preferred.Minimum of 8 Years of relevant experience, preferably in accounting, multinational environment or at one of the big 4 audit firms;Experience in managing a team is preferredKnowledge and experience with US GAAP and IFRS revenue recognition guidance;Knowledge of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act and the requirements as result thereof;Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. IntroductieBen jij een techneut en op zoek naar een rol in een dynamische high-tech werkomgeving? Haal jij je energie uit complexe troubleshooting en het werken aan high-tech apparatuur? Kun je omgaan met de eisen om het maximale uit je toolpark te halen? Ben je gestructureerd genoeg om de technische productieprocessen te overzien en te verbeteren? Ben jij analytisch ingesteld waardoor je onze prestaties verder kunt optimaliseren? Dan is dit DE kans voor jou.ICN8 is de grootste 8-inch wafers fabriek in Europa. Het is een hightech omgeving met veel multidisciplinaire uitdagingen, met meer dan 450 productietools (ASML, ASM/TEL, Applied Material, LAM, ……) en 150 meetinstrumenten (inline inspecties, einde van inline testen).De Equipment Engineer ondersteunt de Equipment and Process Engineering (EPE) organisatie door het onderhouden, initiëren en implementeren van technische verbeteringen en het bieden van ondersteuning aan de productieorganisatie.De uitdagingDe afdeling wet process wordt gekenmerkt als een moderne technische organisatie met een sterke focus op verbeteringen. We zijn een gediversifieerd team met veel energie, een open samenwerkingsomgeving en gretigheid voor continue verbetering. Het team bestaat uit 8-12 engineers en is voornamelijk gericht op het ondersteunen van de productie en werkt actief aan verbetering van de productkwaliteit en toolcapaciteit.Als Equipment Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor een toolpark waarbij je focust ligt bij de complexere problemen. Naast het analyseren en oplossen van problemen ontwikkel en introduceer je actief verbeteringen op het gebied van productkwaliteit, throughput, afvalreductie, kostenbesparingen en reductie van repeaters. Daarnaast ondersteun je (tezamen met EPE collega’s, technicians en operators) de productie zodat de ICN8 organisatie op excellente wijze kan performen. Als equipment engineer rapporteer je aan de Manager EPE IMPLANT/WET/TWM.De verantwoordelijkhedenVerantwoordelijk voor het onderhouden en continu verbeteren van jouw toolpark, welke voldoet aan de veiligheids- en kwaliteitseisen van NXP en aan de geldende normen en validatieverbeteringen op de werkvloer.Verbindt proactief met productie en draagt ​​verbeterideeën aan met betrekking tot structurele technische problemen, kwaliteits gerelateerde zaken en bottleneck issues. Betrekt indien van toepassing andere secties en afdelingen en stuurt deze acties aan tot succesvolle implementatie.Gebruikt technische kennis en ervaring om bij te dragen aan verbeterprojecten.Definieert de benodigde toolcapaciteit en zorgt voor de juiste beschikbaarheid van productietools. Initieert upgrades, ondersteunt onderhoudsacties en lost veiligheidsproblemen op.Bewaakt pro actief de kwaliteit en analyseert/rapporteert incidenten welke gerelateerd zijn aan issues met jouw toolpark.OpleidingOm succesvol te zijn in deze rol beschik je over een BSc. of MSc. niveau in autotechniek, elektronica, mechatronica, werktuigbouwkunde of een ander relevant technisch gebied.Kennis van complexe productieprocessen in een hightech omgeving (bij voorkeur)Kennis van Lean Manufacturing, procesoptimalisatie, statistische machinebesturing, FMEA en kwaliteitsmanagementsystemen (bij voorkeur)Gewenste ervaringVermogen tot het eigen maken van het complexe manufacturing process en de gebruikte technologieënKennis van equipment- en proces technische aspecten van de semiconductor industrieKennis van SPC, basiskennis statistische analyseErvaren met Microsoft OfficeAnalytisch en rationeel denkvermogenContinu vinden/ontwikkelen en implementeren van nieuwe methodieken die performance verbetering mogelijk makenPersoonlijke vaardighedenRaising the bar; Analytisch, pragmatisch, proactief en klantgerichtZelfverzekerd en in staat om mensen te boeien en te overtuigen, ook op hogere managementniveausNeemt initiatief; toont eigenaarschap, heeft een “hands on” mentaliteitSamenwerken; Is een betrouwbare teamspeler, kan goed luisteren en neemt andere ideeën en meningen in zich op. Goede sociale/communicatieve vaardigheden op verschillende niveaus in de organisatieLeert snel, kan prioriteiten stellen en zelfstandig opereren en zich aanpassen aan veranderende omstandigheden gericht op kwaliteit en continue verbeteringStress bestendigResultaat- en kwaliteitsgerichte instellingBeschikt over goede communicatieve vaardighedenOns Young Professional-programma biedt verschillende mogelijkheden voor snelle ontwikkeling in technische en persoonlijke vaardigheden. ICN8 waferfab is een ideale omgeving om de 'echte wereld van productie' te leren kennen.Wat kun je verwachten?Contract: Het betreft een fulltime functie met een vast contract. We staan echter ook open voor een parttime mogelijkheid (tussen 32 en 38 uur).Voordelen: Naast een marktconform salaris bieden wij in het kader van onze CAO mooie voordelen. Een bonusplan, mogelijkheid om extra vakantiedagen bij te kopen, een prima pensioenplan, een goed thuiswerkbeleid en de mogelijkheid om bedrijfsaandelen te kopen met 15% korting zijn slechts enkele voorbeelden van wat NXP te bieden heeft.Ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden: Wij zijn van mening dat het ontwikkelen van onze mensen een belangrijk onderdeel is van de groei van ons bedrijf. Om je in staat te stellen je carrière bij NXP te laten groeien, bieden we je een mix van leren door praktijkervaringen, leren van de beste experts in de branche en leren door middel van onderwijs en opleidingen om je te helpen je kern- en professionele vaardigheden te ontwikkelen.Onze kantoren: Nederland is de thuisbasis van ons wereldwijde hoofdkantoor (Eindhoven) samen met twee extra locaties (Nijmegen, Delft) en omvat een divers team van meer dan 2000 medewerkers met 51 verschillende nationaliteiten gericht op R&D, productie, productontwikkeling, bedrijfsvoering, juridische en verkoop.Wervingsproces: Solliciteren duurt slechts een minuut! Vul dan de online sollicitatie in en deel je CV met ons. Na een positieve screening op basis van je CV heb je een eerste videogesprek met onze Talent Acquisition Consultant gevolgd door verschillende zakelijke interviews. Hier zijn enkele handige tips om u te helpen bij de voorbereiding.En meer: het leven bij NXP is meer dan alleen werken. Doe mee met een van de vele sociale activiteiten die door en voor medewerkers in Nederland worden georganiseerd, zoals onze kerstfeesten en Internationale Wandeldag. We hebben een YOUNG community die een mix van sociale en professionele evenementen organiseert voor onze jonge professionals en een actieve Vrouwen in NXP community.Wat is de volgende stap?Als je enthousiast bent over deze uitdaging, dan nodigen we je van harte uit om te solliciteren! Als u vragen heeft, beantwoorden wij deze graag. Neem contact op met (Miguel Ortiz, Talent Acquisition Specialist op miguel.ortiz@nxp.com). Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

The future starts here! Ready to join NXP in Design for Test ?The DFT and Test department, location Eindhoven, The Netherlands, is part of the MCU-MPU Engineering, Design Enablement (MME-DE) organization. The department has the charter to provide NXP customized Electronic Design Automation (EDA) solutions in the area of Analog / Mixed Signal Test, and Design For Test (DFT) as required by our IC design community, based on the work of the department and our EDA vendors. To do this, we utilize a flexible composite of EDA tools and flows to encapsulate the required solution. A major competence is therefore software engineering, covering all aspects from requirements development through solution architectures to software development, configuration management, test and maintenance / support.The continuing trend in semiconductor with on one hand increasing design sizes and on the other hand a demand for very low PPM, or even PPB, presents a challenge for the future in how to address production test. Requirements towards both secure design and functional safety make this an even bigger challenge. We are looking for a Software Engineer DFT Diagnosis Tool/Flow Development who can develop automated solutions for DFT methodology, with a focus on the scan and volume diagnosis space. A high visibility role with opportunity to have a large impact on design quality and manufacturability.Your ResponsibilitiesAs a Software Engineer DFT Diagnosis Tool/Flow Development, you are responsible for:Develop NXP proprietary tools, flows and methodologies to address DFT related challengesArchitect / Develop / Design / Implement / Test / Document reliable and maintainable softwareDevelop specifications in a good interaction with product managers, peer engineers, support engineersDevelop / maintain a broad knowledge of technical developments in software application domainSupport the development and/or execution of test specifications developed by application engineersSupport the maintenance of department products/solutions and provide second-line support as required in cooperation with application/support engineersYour TeamThe Software Engineer DFT Tool/Flow Development operates in a small team in Eindhoven with peers in San Diego (USA), Noida (IN), Bangalore (IN) and Toulouse (FR), responsible for the development and deployment of Design for Test methods supporting IC designers in NXP.Your Profile To be successful in this role you have:Bachelor or Master Degree in Computer Science, Electronic, Electrical Engineering or equivalentaround 2 - 8+ years of working experience in semiconductor industry, preferably in CAD/EDA spacesolid hands-on experience in developing tools, automation flows using Python, C++, TCL or bash along with hands on exposure to SQL or NoSQL databasesAcumen in Software development life cycle. Hand-On experience in agile techniques (using git, JIRA, gerrit, Jenkins, dockers) and cloud readyExperience with DfT methodologies, design and test automation, and a working understanding of fault models with scan test is considered a proHas affinity for all aspects of DfT architecture and Design MethodologyExperience to work in a multicultural environmentFurthermore, you are/have:Persistent in problem solving, never give up mentality in a dynamic environmentFrugal, result oriented, KPI driven and customer obsessionGood communication skillsAn enthusiastic team workerFluent in English language, verbal and written. Command of the Dutch language is a plus, but no prerequisiteCreating Secure Connections and Infrastructure for a Smarter WorldNXP Semiconductors N.V. (NASDAQ: NXPI) makes products and environments safer, more sustainable, and more secure with innovative connectivity and edge processing solutions for a smarter world.We are in the business of better. Not just better technologies, but better innovations to improve society. As the world leader in secure connectivity and processing solutions for embedded applications, NXP is solving the world’s most complex technology challenges to accelerate business innovation, enhance how we work, and advance how we live.Ready to create a smarter world? Visit our career website and follow us on social: LinkedIn, Facebook, and Twitter.To learn more about NXP in the Netherlands, click here or visit our showroom hereWhat can you expectContract: This is a full-time position with a permanent contract. However, we are open to discuss a part-time opportunity (between 32 and 38 hours) as well.Benefits: Besides a competitive salary, we offer great benefits as part of our CLA. A bonus plan, possibility to purchase extra holidays, an excellent pension plan, a work from home policy, and the possibility to buy company shares with a 15% discount are some examples. When applicable we also provide a relocation package and support for your move to the Netherlands.Development opportunities: We believe that a key component to growing our business is to develop our people. To enable you to grow your career at NXP, we provide you with a mix of learning through on-the-job experiences, learning from industries bests, and learning through education to help you develop your core and professional skills. Our offices: The Netherlands is home to our global headquarters (Eindhoven) along with two additional sites (Nijmegen, Delft) and includes a diverse team of over 2000 employees with 51 different nationalities focused on R&D, manufacturing, product development, business operations, legal and sales.Hiring process: Applying only takes a minute! Fill in the online application and share your CV with us. After a positive screening based on your CV you will have an initial video conversation with our Talent Acquisition Consultant followed by several business interviews. Here are some useful tips to help you prepare. And more: Life at NXP is more than work alone. Join one of the many social activities that are organized by and for employees in the Netherlands, such as our Christmas parties and International Walking Day. We have a YOUNG community that organizes a mix of social and professional events for our young professionals and an active Women in NXP. We also take time to give back to our communities by engaging young girls to learn about Technology during Girls Day or participating in several volunteering activities.What’s next?If you’re excited about this opportunity, we kindly invite you to apply! If you have any questions, we are happy to answer them. Please contact Samira Chalh, Talent Acquisition Specialist samira.chalh@nxp.com Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Als Test Equipment engineer (ATE) maak je deel uit van de TEST organisatie in Nijmegen.Deze functie is ook passend voor een afgestudeerde starter met een afgeronde HBO of MBO opleiding of voor iemand die een volgende stap wil maken in zijn carrière. In deze functie zul je groeien en leren om in de toekomst een expert te zijn.Het TEST team is sterk betrokken bij TEST-innovatie om nieuwe testtechnologieën, processen en apparatuur voor TEST-oplossingen te definiëren, valideren en implementeren ter ondersteuning van de introductie van nieuwe producten (NPI).Je ondersteunt het team met je kennis en adviseert met betrekking tot wafer- en final testprocessen, inclusief wafer-/productbehandeling en je werkt met de nieuwste apparatuur die daarmee verband houdt.Ons teamProductvrijgave - Global NPI Test Center Nijmegen (GNTC-N) levert gestandaardiseerde oplossingen voor het gehele test ecosysteem, waardoor onze producten toonaangevende testprestaties kunnen leveren wat betreft kwaliteit, time-to-market en kosten. Hierbij kiezen ze een strategie om ontwerp, teststrategieën, testflows en dergelijke te beïnvloeden, gericht op nieuwe technologieën en oplossingen.Jouw verantwoordelijkhedenEigenaar van
