AssemblyAI is a remote-first AI company building powerful deep learning models for developers, startups, and enterprises to transcribe and understand their audio data.Our Automated Speech Recognition (ASR) models already outperform companies like Google, AWS, and Microsoft - which is why hundreds of companies and thousands of developers are using our APIs to transcribe and understand millions of videos, podcasts, phone calls, and zoom meetings every day. Our APIs power innovative products like conversational intelligence platforms, zoom meeting summarizers, content moderation, and automatic closed captioning.AssemblyAI's Speech-to-Text APIs are already trusted by Fortune 500s, startups, and thousands of developers around the world, with well-known customers including Spotify, Algolia, Dow Jones, Happy Scribe, BBC, The Wall Street Journal, and NBCUniversal. As part of a huge and emerging market, AssemblyAI is well on its way to becoming the leader in speech recognition and NLP.We're growing at breakneck speed, and recently announced our Series B round. We've raised $63M in total funding, and are backed by leading investors including Insight Partners, Accel, Y Combinator, Patrick and John Collision (Founders of Stripe), Nat Friedman (Former CEO of GitHub), and Daniel Gross (Entrepreneur & Investor in companies including GitHub, Uber & SpaceX)!Our ambition is to build an iconic AI company, making advanced deep learning technology accessible to everyday developers through a simple API, good docs, and a great developer experience.Join our world-class, remote team and help us build an iconic deep learning company!The RoleAssemblyAI is growing quickly, and we're searching for a front-end engineer who is fluent in React/TypeScript/Sass that's excited to work closely with our existing web and marketing teams. With significant investment and strong leadership to fuel our growth, it's the perfect time to join the AssemblyAI team.In this role you'll have the opportunity to:Work closely with web & marketing teams to implement strategy. You will work closely with marketing and implement the latest strategies. This role is perfect for someone who loves to Someone to obsess over ads, conversion rates, A/B testing, product usability, user flows, and more. Build landing pages and help all email marketing efforts. You will be responsible for helping all email marketing efforts and will build beautiful templates. You will also build landing pages from scratch or using a no-code tool, as well as watch our metrics closely and quickly take actions and experiment. Requirements5+ years of professional web applications development experienceStrong knowledge of TypeScript, JavaScript, and CSS (Sass)Experience working with ReactKnowledge of design patterns, enterprise architecture and software engineering principlesGood communication and personal skills: ability to interact and work well with members of other functional groups in a project team and a strong sense of project ownershipSkillsYou write great code and have a great eye for designYou are passionate about numbers and data visualizationGreat appreciation for art, design, and user experienceStrong problem solving skillsStrong technical, analytical, and product backgroundsUS Salary Range: $100,000 - $165,000 USD per year Remote Locations: North America, LATAM, EuropeOur TeamOur team is made up of problem solvers, innovators and top AI researchers with over 20+ years of experience in Machine Learning, NLP, and Speech Recognition from companies like DeepMind, Google Brain, Meta, Apple and Amazon. They conduct cutting edge deep learning research and develop novel algorithms & techniques to continually push the state of the art in speech recognition & NLP!Our team is fully remote, and our culture is super collaborative, low-ego, transparent, and fast-paced. We want to win - and have a flat organization where everyone can openly share ideas (regardless of their title or position) in order to get the best idea.As a remote company, our team members are given a lot of trust and autonomy to work where and how they want. We look for people to join our team who are ambitious, curious, and self-motivated, and we put a lot of trust and autonomy into everyone on our team. We want to empower everyone to do their best work with whatever tools, structures, or resources they need to perform at their highest potential.BenefitsCompetitive Salary + BonusEquity100% Remote teamUnlimited PTO$1K budget for your home office setupNew Macbook Pro (or PC if you prefer)1x/year company paid team retreat Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Company DescriptionHi there, potential colleague! Join us in our mission to become a driver of positive change in the eyewear industry.Get ready to make a real impact in a certified B Corp as our new CRM Intern. In this position, you will support our CRM initiatives as part of our digital team.This position is full-time and available from July onwards at our HQ in Amsterdam for a period of 6 months.You'll be...Working with the CRM manager in developing segmentation and communication strategies for our new and existing customers. Building Email marketing campaigns and automation from planning to executionAnalysing consumer data and campaign performance and making actionable insightsAssisting in business initiatives and projects to improve our offline and online business with special focus on our existing customersWorking closely with the creative and digital team in supporting and preparation of product and campaign launches Using your creativity in innovating new ways to engage with our existing customers and improving retention.You...Are studying or have just finished relevant studies (HBO/WO in Business, Marketing, Mathematics or Psychology)Have good knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets and/or other toolsHave a sharp eye for detail Are data driven but also able to give contribution to the creative partAre a strong team player with the ability to take responsibility and work independentlyAre keen to learn about and gain practical experience in Email marketing, including basic template coding in HTML, Digital Marketing and Customer Relationship ManagementBasic knowledge of email tools and HTML, CSS, SQL or scripting languages is a plus (but not required). What's In It For You...A flexible hybrid work environment (minimum two days per week at the office)Personal development opportunities10 holidays per 6 months (on a full time basis)€500,- monthly internship allowanceDaily nutritious lunch! A lot of learning on the job and personal developmentParticipation in events planned by our CultureClub (e.g. Borrel XXL, &talks, holiday gifting...)Frequent updates to your eyewear collection!Jeez, that was a lot. Still with us? If you are, and you’re thinking that you might fit this profile, please apply via the form below. We’d love to hear from you!Excited, but in need of a bit more information? We are more than happy to welcome you here at our office (or somewhere else) for an introductory coffee.Ace & Tate is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to nurturing an inclusive environment for all current and potential employees Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Welcome to SkillLabAt SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has a pathway to employment. To realize this vision, we develop a mobile app to provide skill based career guidance to job seekers around the globe.Your opportunitySay goodbye to various approval loops to change app icons. You will be working on big, new features and immediately see the result of your engineering work.You will work on an innovative and AI-driven career guidance solution that will help millions of (marginalized) job seekers across the world to find jobs and education.You will experience the culture of a technology start-up with a social mission. This is not your standard corporate job.Your teamYou will join our product team as the new senior front-end software engineer: Ragnar is one of our co-founders and leads the Product Team. You will closely work with him and directly report to him. Aaron M, Gaspar, Kilani, Ibraheem, Ivana, Lala, Vladislav, Mohammad and Barry are SkillLab’s software engineers Hamza is our DevOps Engineer and Luiza our QA engineer Mohammad and Hadeel are SkillLab's product managers Aaron S, Rihab and Anna are our data scientists Dan, Giulia B and Giulia V lead our product design Mirette is our user researcherWhat you will doYou will write the code for new features that will make the front-end of our career guidance solution beautiful and the user experience seamlessYou will ensure that every job seeker (regardless of age, gender, culture) can get personalized career guidance through our appYou will code using React and TypeScriptYou collaborate with the other engineers through code reviews and by integrating with our backend and DevOps infrastructureYou learn how we leverage the power of Artificial Intelligence to allow job seekers to better understand their skills and get matched to education and jobsRequirementsIs this you?You are excited about our social mission to empower everyone to have a pathway to employmentYou have 7+ years of experience in front-end development, with extensive knowledge in TypeScript, React (version 18+ with hooks), PWAs, Material UI and other libraries in the React ecosystem (emotion, jest, redux, swr).You have a learning mindset and bring the drive and curiosity to tackle new coding challengesYou work collaboratively in an engineering team and are empathic towards our end-usersExtra awesomeYou have experience leading a team of software engineersYou speak and read ArabicYou have some experience of Ruby and Rails, Storybook, animation frameworks, bundlers, service workers, Web APIs, or Google CloudSalary, start-date & locationWe use a salary benchmark for the Dutch high-tech sector to set your salary based on your experience. We expect that the annual gross salary for the experience we are looking for ranges from 70k-85k Euro per year.We strongly prefer on-site candidates who live in Amsterdam or the Netherlands. However, we are open to remote applicants who will make intermittent trips to Amsterdam from cities within the Netherlands.We accept applications on a rolling basis, and we envision a start date as soon as possible.BenefitsYou will enjoy 25 paid vacation days per year (20 days as the statutory minimum holiday entitlement in the Netherlands plus 5 extra days from SkillLab).You can work flexibly both from our office in Amsterdam or remotely within the Netherlands. You can also extend your holiday stay in a different country and work from abroad for a limited period of time.You will get an extensive relocation support to move to Amsterdam including visa sponsorship, 30% ruling application, your plane tickets, covered real estate agent fees, first 2-weeks of hotel accommodation etc.You will have a personal learning budget to invest in your professional development.You will have access to mentors & coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator).You will have access to a monthly flexible budget of benefits via Yourcampus app. You can spend this budget on a large selection of providers, ranging from gym memberships to bike subscriptions and online stores. You will join our bi-annual company offsite retreats in different locations like Italy, Belgium, Germany etc.What else to know?SkillLab is committed to diversity, equality and inclusion at the workplace. We welcome applications of candidates from all backgrounds.This is our tech stack and how we build technology with impact. (Building technology with impact - SkillLab )Get 3 tips for your job application at SkillLab (Three Tips for your Job Application - SkillLab )If this job is not for you, perhaps you have a friend who might be a good fit. Send them this job posting. Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

The Department of Industrial Design (ID) is one of the nine departments of TU/e and has an internationally leading position because of its core commitment to research through design (RtD) and its strikingly original conceptual work. ID’s ambition is to be recognized as one of the top departments in the world that conduct exciting research in the intersection of Design, Technology, Human-Computer Interaction, and Social Sciences and Humanities. In particular, the department aims to inspire and educate a new generation of design engineers who can contribute with their novel designs, their fluency in AI/ML algorithms and data, and their academic critical questioning, to the imminent and complex societal challenges our world is facing nowadays.The ID education program is competence-centered, self-directed and challenged-based. ID focuses on educating students to design through five different perspectives (called Expertise Areas), through core courses and electives:Math, data and computing.User and society.Technology and realization.Business and entrepreneurship.Creativity and aesthetics.Students also learn to make connections between the different perspectives within project groups called squads. In addition, the ID education curriculum encourages and empowers students to take the ownership of their personal and professional development. Supported by their academic coaches, through ID curriculum and their personal, industrial and research projects, students develop a unique competence of designing and related design approaches individually. Next to self-directed learning and competence development, the educational model of ID is challenge-based. ID students work together on challenging and authentic projects in which multiple perspectives or disciplines are incorporated to solve the challenge (for example by working within interdisciplinary groups) using an entrepreneurial mindset.At the Industrial Design department we have two research groups: Systemic Change and Future Everyday.Job DescriptionResearch: You have a design focus on data interaction and information visualization, a keen sense of data quality and meaningful interactions with data. In Industrial Design, we look for effective and aesthetic ways of presenting large-scale, complex data to diverse audiences and to support various types of users. This could mean supporting professionals in complex tasks using high-dimensional data streams, personal health informatics using on-body sensing, analytics for contemporary learning environments, or even public information visualization for civic engagement. In addition, we focus on how data evolves and changes, and how our understanding and sense-making such data will be dynamic, adaptive and evolving over time. This means interactive qualities of the data interaction allows for agency and active roles in the interpretation of data in context. You will develop novel concepts and applications, and related design methodology and technologies to support the application of data analytics in different application domains. You are familiar with current data visualization and interaction technologies and you have the ambition and track record of contributing to the development of tools, methods and theory to guide and inspire designers in this field, connecting to design methodologies such as data-driven design and data-enabled design.Education: You will contribute to our educational expertise in the areas of “Math, Data & Computing”, and “Creativity & Aesthetics” through courses at bachelor’s and master’s level in topics related to data and information visualization, generative design, designing with data, and data analytics. Furthermore, education will involve the definition and coaching of student projects at bachelor’s and master’s level, and our post-graduate programs.Job RequirementsMotivated researcher, with a PhD in Design, HCI, Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering or other related disciplines.Ability to conduct high quality academic research, reflected in demonstratable outputs.Motivated to teach, contribute to teaching processes, and to develop excellent teaching skills.Strong cooperation skills and ability to work in an interdisciplinary team.Effective communication and leadership skills, including coaching and mentoring of students and staff, leading a project or chairing a group.Excellent (written and verbal) proficiency in English. Conditions of employmentSalary in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities, scale 11/12 (min. €3974 - max. €6281).A year-end bonus of 8.3% and annual vacation pay of 8%.A dedicated mentoring program to help you get to know the university and the Dutch (research) environment.High-quality training programs for academic leadership and teaching.An excellent technical infrastructure, on-campus children's day care and sports facilities.Partially paid parental leave and an allowance for commuting, working from home and internet costs.A Staff Immigration Team is available for international candidates, as are a tax compensation scheme (the 30% facility) and partner career support . Information and applicationAbout UsEindhoven University of Technology is an internationally top-ranking university in the Netherlands that combines scientific curiosity with a hands-on attitude. Our spirit of collaboration translates into an open culture and a top-five position in collaborating with advanced industries. Fundamental knowledge enables us to design solutions for the highly complex problems of today and tomorrow.Curious to hear more about what it is like as a professor at TU/e? Please view the video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=85ApbAfeCcM .Information Do you recognize yourself in this profile and would you like to know more?Please contact prof.dr. Panos Markopoulos p.markopoulos[at]tue.nl.Visit our website for more information about the application process or the conditions of employment. You can also contact Jolanda van der Sande, HR advisor, j.i.v.d.sande[at]tue.nl.Are you inspired and would like to know more about working at TU/e? Please visit our career page .ApplicationWe invite you to submit a complete application.The application should include a:Cover letter in which you describe your motivation and qualifications for the position.Curriculum vitae, including a list of your publications and the contact information of three references.Description of your scientific interests and plans (1-2 pages).Statement of your teaching goals and experience (1-2 pages).We look forward to receiving your application and will screen it as soon as possible. The vacancy will remain open until the position is filled. Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Locatie: Apeldoorn - De BrugSalarisschaal: StagevergoedingOpleiding: WOSoort dienstverband: stageWerkervaring: Reageren voor: Do you want to be a part of a data-oriented organisation? Come and provide the Data Science Team with some fresh energy. We provide the opportunity to gain work experience and get acquainted with Kadaster. Put yourself on the map by applying for the following:Data Science InternKadaster’s Data Science Team is involved in various innovation projects and support various organisational challenges. You work, in collaboration with EuroSDR, on assignments related to graph alignment, metadata management and semantic technologies.Background information on the cooperation with EuroSDREuroSDR (non-profit organisation) links national mapping and cadastral agencies to research institutes, universities and companies in Europe. They do this to support applied research in spatial data provision, management and delivery. Kadaster supports the ‘Linking Data in Europe’ project within the EuroSDR working group on Linked Data. This project has attracted EuroSDR members and their network across Europe and supports the linking of data based on metadata using semantic technologies.The EuroSDR project ‘Linking Data in Europe’ focuses primarily on the transformation and publication of metadata to linked data, combining metadata on both a structural and semantic level and creating tools which support the linking of metadata records to each other. The most important deliverable for this project is the metadata knowledge graph (MKG).Combining data from different domains and different countries remains a challenge. This is due to the lack of homogeneity in both the structure and semantics of this data. In addition, merging datasets for different use cases first requires that relevant datasets be found and that the content can be selected for reuse. Losing time finding information, understanding what is useful for the use case and combining this information in a logical way leaves less time and money to create real value by using this data for a range of use cases.Metadata is central to supporting both findability and accessibility of data. The metadata must be of sufficient quality and rich enough that users can decide on the data that is relevant to a particular use case.Both internships will be guided by members of the EuroSDR Linked Data group and interns will have frequent contact with the project group and the partner organizations involved. Two internships have been defined to support this project.What are you going to do?You can choose from one of the below assignments:Internship 1: Development of the Metadata WizardWe want to support users in the transformation from meta data to linked data and support in editing and enriching metadata for publication in the metadata knowledge graph. It is, therefore, important to provide users with the right tooling. The requirements for this tool have been drawn up by members of the EuroSDR Linked Data Group. One of these requirements is that the tool be developed based on the LDWizard: https://github.com/pldn/LDWizard, which is an open-source tool that supports the transformation from data to linked data in a user-friendly way.The selected intern will work towards building a toolset that will import in an intelligent way metadata from diverse sources related to spatiotemporal data and will add this metadata to a Knowledge Graph(KG) where they can be linked with previously existing metadata. The developed toolset would need to process, understand, link and semantically enrich the provided metadata.Internship 2: Graph Alignment, Semantic Mapping and OntologiesMetadata for digital assets in Europe exists in different formats with a range of standards and vocabularies. However, metadata follows its own semantic descriptions using one or more of the metadata vocabularies, which are ultimately part of the MKG. Before the metadata to linked data transformation can be performed, the range of metadata vocabularies must be identified and aligned.We do this to support the semantic and structural homogeneity of metadata. This enables us to enrich existing metadata with more information. To support improved findability and searchability of digital resources in Europe. Modern solutions in this area include the use of machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) techniques to enable greater intelligence and precise alignment and linkage of the spatiotemporal metadata.You design the model for the metadata knowledge graph and transform instance data to create the metadata knowledge graph.The teamThe Data Science Team consists of 17 colleagues. We take a look both inside and outside Kadaster at the very latest technologies, such as data science, data innovations and opportunities for collaboration. We help our colleagues with various issues and work together with external parties such as universities. We apply technology where it is possible that it contributes to the digital transformation of Kadaster. You work closely (digitally) with colleagues from the EuroSDR in France.Do you want to know what the colleagues and trainees from the data science team do exactly? Check out: https://labs.kadaster.nl/Your profileYou are following a relevant course at higher vocational or university level, such as Software Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science or another course that is related. You have experience and interest in (geo) data analysis and conducting research. For the first internship assignment it is important that you have knowledge or experience with web application development, docker, typescript and react. For the second internship assignment, it is important that you have knowledge of or experience with software semantic modelling, pipeline scripting, SPARQL and linked data technologies. We coordinate the start date in consultation with each other. You are available for approximately 6 months.We offerYou work in a pleasant working environment where you get all the space to ask questions.We give you the opportunity to develop your talents. We also offer: good supervision during the internship. Your internship supervisor knows the profession well, guides you professionally and helps you grow. a laptop that you can use during your internship. working from home is combined with working at the office at our location 'De Brug' in Apeldoorn. The location is easily accessible by public transport. more than 250 training courses in our own digital learning environment. So you can get a little better every day. an internship allowance of €565 (based on a 36-hour internship week). interactive and fun student sessions for all interns.Interested?Would you like to apply and submit your resume and motivation letter to us? You can do that via the orange button at the bottom of this page! Do you have questions about the internship? Get in touch. We can be reached via WhatsApp, telephone and e-mail.Lisette Velthorst+31 6 15 95 73 15 (ook WhatsApp)lisette.velthorst@kadaster.nl Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Locatie: Apeldoorn - De BrugSalarisschaal: StagevergoedingOpleiding: WOSoort dienstverband: stageWerkervaring: Reageren voor: Do you want to be a part of a data-oriented organisation? Come and provide the Data Science Team with some fresh energy. We provide the opportunity to gain work experience and get acquainted with Kadaster. Put yourself on the map by applying for the following:Data Science InternKadaster’s Data Science Team is involved in various innovation projects and support various organisational challenges. You work, in collaboration with EuroSDR, on assignments related to graph alignment, metadata management and semantic technologies.Background information on the cooperation with EuroSDREuroSDR (non-profit organisation) links national mapping and cadastral agencies to research institutes, universities and companies in Europe. They do this to support applied research in spatial data provision, management and delivery. Kadaster supports the ‘Linking Data in Europe’ project within the EuroSDR working group on Linked Data. This project has attracted EuroSDR members and their network across Europe and supports the linking of data based on metadata using semantic technologies.The EuroSDR project ‘Linking Data in Europe’ focuses primarily on the transformation and publication of metadata to linked data, combining metadata on both a structural and semantic level and creating tools which support the linking of metadata records to each other. The most important deliverable for this project is the metadata knowledge graph (MKG).Combining data from different domains and different countries remains a challenge. This is due to the lack of homogeneity in both the structure and semantics of this data. In addition, merging datasets for different use cases first requires that relevant datasets be found and that the content can be selected for reuse. Losing time finding information, understanding what is useful for the use case and combining this information in a logical way leaves less time and money to create real value by using this data for a range of use cases.Metadata is central to supporting both findability and accessibility of data. The metadata must be of sufficient quality and rich enough that users can decide on the data that is relevant to a particular use case.Both internships will be guided by members of the EuroSDR Linked Data group and interns will have frequent contact with the project group and the partner organizations involved. Two internships have been defined to support this project.What are you going to do?You can choose from one of the below assignments:Internship 1: Development of the Metadata WizardWe want to support users in the transformation from meta data to linked data and support in editing and enriching metadata for publication in the metadata knowledge graph. It is, therefore, important to provide users with the right tooling. The requirements for this tool have been drawn up by members of the EuroSDR Linked Data Group. One of these requirements is that the tool be developed based on the LDWizard: https://github.com/pldn/LDWizard, which is an open-source tool that supports the transformation from data to linked data in a user-friendly way.The selected intern will work towards building a toolset that will import in an intelligent way metadata from diverse sources related to spatiotemporal data and will add this metadata to a Knowledge Graph(KG) where they can be linked with previously existing metadata. The developed toolset would need to process, understand, link and semantically enrich the provided metadata.Internship 2: Graph Alignment, Semantic Mapping and OntologiesMetadata for digital assets in Europe exists in different formats with a range of standards and vocabularies. However, metadata follows its own semantic descriptions using one or more of the metadata vocabularies, which are ultimately part of the MKG. Before the metadata to linked data transformation can be performed, the range of metadata vocabularies must be identified and aligned.We do this to support the semantic and structural homogeneity of metadata. This enables us to enrich existing metadata with more information. To support improved findability and searchability of digital resources in Europe. Modern solutions in this area include the use of machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) techniques to enable greater intelligence and precise alignment and linkage of the spatiotemporal metadata.You design the model for the metadata knowledge graph and transform instance data to create the metadata knowledge graph.The teamThe Data Science Team consists of 17 colleagues. We take a look both inside and outside Kadaster at the very latest technologies, such as data science, data innovations and opportunities for collaboration. We help our colleagues with various issues and work together with external parties such as universities. We apply technology where it is possible that it contributes to the digital transformation of Kadaster. You work closely (digitally) with colleagues from the EuroSDR in France.Do you want to know what the colleagues and trainees from the data science team do exactly? Check out: https://labs.kadaster.nl/Your profileYou are following a relevant course at higher vocational or university level, such as Software Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science or another course that is related. You have experience and interest in (geo) data analysis and conducting research. For the first internship assignment it is important that you have knowledge or experience with web application development, docker, typescript and react. For the second internship assignment, it is important that you have knowledge of or experience with software semantic modelling, pipeline scripting, SPARQL and linked data technologies. We coordinate the start date in consultation with each other. You are available for approximately 6 months.We offerYou work in a pleasant working environment where you get all the space to ask questions.We give you the opportunity to develop your talents. We also offer: good supervision during the internship. Your internship supervisor knows the profession well, guides you professionally and helps you grow. a laptop that you can use during your internship. working from home is combined with working at the office at our location 'De Brug' in Apeldoorn. The location is easily accessible by public transport. more than 250 training courses in our own digital learning environment. So you can get a little better every day. an internship allowance of €565 (based on a 36-hour internship week). interactive and fun student sessions for all interns.Interested?Would you like to apply and submit your resume and motivation letter to us? You can do that via the orange button at the bottom of this page! Do you have questions about the internship? Get in touch. We can be reached via WhatsApp, telephone and e-mail.Lisette Velthorst+31 6 15 95 73 15 (ook WhatsApp)lisette.velthorst@kadaster.nl Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Ben jij de volgende Python / all-round web developer voor Leukeleu? Kom dan in contact, dan kijken we gezamenlijk verder of je stappen kan maken in salaris en professionele ontwikkeling!De vacatureJij bent een Python web developer met gevoel voor gebruiksvriendelijkheid en duidelijk gestructureerde code. Je schrijft graag moderne Python code, met ‘The Zen of Python / PEP 20’ in je achterhoofd. Daarbij word je enthousiast van simpele, goed geteste code, heldere datamodellen, mooie API’s, pijnloze deploys en een uitmuntende aansluiting op interactieve Vue / React frontends. Je werkt graag samen met enthousiaste collega’s, die net als jij hoge kwaliteit willen leveren in nauwe samenwerking met onze klanten.Je leert dagelijks van én met elkaar. Het is belangrijk dat je communicatief bent en je goed kunt verplaatsen in (de klant van) onze klanten. Zodat we samen continu beter worden, en steeds mooiere dingen maken. Omdat we Agile / Scrum werken is onze taak helder en bereiken we resultaat. Scrum werken doen we met verve. En dat het werkt zie je aan het resultaat van de sprints, en aan de goeie sfeer tijdens de demo’s en retro’s. We zoeken iemand met een ‘brede blik’, iemand die ook graag de stap maakt naar HTML, JavaScript en CSS.Bij ons wordt er niets over de schutting gegooid van backend naar frontend of andersom, sterker nog: er is niet eens een schutting. Bij voorkeur heb je ervaring met Django en Vue / React, maar als je gewoon heel leergierig bent en je je snel dingen eigen maakt, vinden wij dat misschien nog wel beter.Hier gaan we vanuitJe hebt minimaal 1 jaar ervaring met Python, en bij voorkeur ook met DjangoJe hebt interesse in de hele stack (frontend, backend en devops)Je bent leergierig en maakt je dingen snel eigenJe werkt Agile / Scrum, en bent Open Source-mindedJe wilt graag, samen met je collega’s, continu beter wordenArbeidsvoorwaardenJe krijgt een salaris van 3000 tot 4500 euro bruto per maandJe hebt recht op 24 vakantiedagenDe tijden van je werk zijn flexibelVoor deze functie is het mogelijk om thuis te werkenDe reiskostenvergoeding is 19 cent per kilometerEr zullen trainingen worden gegevenBudget voor opleidingenBijdrage voor pensioenRelevante onkosten worden vergoedAls medewerker heb je recht op verzorgde lunchVoor deze functie heb je recht op een laptop van de zaakEr is een bonusregeling aanwezigOver Leukeleu:Wij zijn Leukeleu. We zijn de technische partner van onze klanten, met gevoel voor design en gebruiksgemak. We bouwen mooie, goed doordachte websites en webapplicaties. Die niet alleen goed in elkaar zitten, maar ook écht lekker werken. Wij zijn alleskunners. Bij ons geen harde splitsing in frontend en backend, maar we hebben natuurlijk wel allemaal onze eigen specialismes. We werken met Open Source, en gebruiken bewezen techniek zoals Vue, React en Django. We werken Agile (Scrum). Agile betekent voor ons: samenwerken en weten waar je aan toe bent. Vanaf het begin, samen met een Product Owner van de klant. Zo werken we altijd aan functionaliteit die op dat moment de meeste waarde toevoegt. En blijft er ruimte om bij te sturen. Als developer ben je bij ons onderdeel van een leuk team, waarin we graag van elkaar leren. We gaan samen naar meetups en organiseren ze soms ook zelf. Er is veel ruimte voor je persoonlijke ontwikkeling, zowel in “learning on the job” als met je jaarlijkse budget voor cursussen en conferenties.02/01/2006De gemiddelde leeftijd is 36.Werkzaam in 1 kantoor. IntroductionWe’re Hiring!Student Affairs Officer0,6 FTE - 0,8 FTE (24 - 32 hrs. p/w)We are looking to recruit a reliable and flexible student affairs officer to join our compact team (6 p.) of support staff at the Tinbergen Institute. Names after Professor Jan Tinbergen, the Dutch Nobel Prize laureate in Economics (1969), the Tinbergen Institute (TI), founded in 1987, is today one of the major economic research institutes in the Netherlands, with more than 150 research fellows, over 200 PhD and over 770 PhD alumni. The institute hosts nearly 100 research master students in two programs, one in economics, econometrics, and finance and the other in business data science. TI has offices in both Amsterdam and Rotterdam.Job DescriptionThe core focus of the student affairs officer is to:Provide administrative support to the Directors of Graduate Studies (2 DGS) and the education coordinator:support all facets of the highly selective research master programs, from welcoming the new students, to administering the courses, through graduation;communicate with teachers and fellows to maintain course guides and study manuals;ensure all courses, course schedules, enrollments, and grades are reflected in the educational monitoring system (Osiris) and learning environment system (Canvas);Provide administrative support for quality assurance. run the secretariat of the Examination Board. The above-mentioned tasks highlight just a few of the day-to-day activities and responsibilities and do not entail a complete overview.Job requirementsA successful candidate will have:a Bachelor degree or work experience on Bachelor level;You have at least 2 years of relevant work experience within an educational institution, preferably within a university or university of applied sciences;good knowledge of Dutch and English in word and writing (C1 level);a high level of integrity, accuracy, reliability, and ability to adapt to process changes;a combination of patience and the ability to work under deadline pressure;great team spirit: ability to collaborate with the rest of the staff, both academic and support staff, while working independently. Employment conditions and benefitsWe offer a contract with Erasmus University Rotterdam, initially for one year based on 0,6 - 0,8 fte (24 – 32 hrs. p/w). After this, the contract can be converted into a permanent position if the organisational conditions remain unchanged and performance is satisfactory.In accordance with the conditions applied at Erasmus University Rotterdam as indicated in the Collective Labour Agreement of the Dutch universities, the gross monthly salary is in the range € 2,818.- to € 3,764.- (scale 8, Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities) for full-time employment.In addition, we offer an 8% holiday allowance, an end-of-year payment of 8.3%, and a very generous paid leave scheme. Furthermore, EUR is affiliated with ABP for the pension provision, and we offer partially paid parental leave, fully paid extended birth leave for partners, a personal career budget, free and unlimited access to our online learning environment GoodHabitz, work-life balance coaches, discounted collective health insurance, and more. As an employee, you can also use EUR facilities such as the University library and receive a discount on subscriptions for the Erasmus sports center.Erasmus University Rotterdam aspires to be an equitable and inclusive community. We nurture an open culture, where everyone is supported to fulfil their full potential. We see inclusivity of talent as the basis of our successes, and the diversity of perspectives and people as a highly valued outcome. EUR provides equal opportunities to all employees and applicants regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, functional impairment, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes them unique. We look forward to welcoming you to our community.EmployerErasmus University Rotterdam (EUR) is an internationally oriented university with a strong social orientation in its education and research, as expressed in our mission ‘Creating positive societal impact’. EUR is home to 3.700 academics and professionals and almost 33.000 students from more than 140 countries. Everything we do, we do under the credo The Erasmian Way – Making Minds Matter. We’re global citizens, connecting, entrepreneurial, open-minded, and socially involved. These Erasmian Values function as our internal compass and create EUR’s distinctive and recognizable profile. From these values, with a broad perspective and with an eye for diversity, different backgrounds and opinions, our employees work closely together to solve societal challenges from the dynamic and cosmopolitan city of Rotterdam. Thanks to the high quality and positive societal impact of our research and education, EUR can compete with the top European universities. www.eur.nl.Faculty / Institute / Central serviceThe Erasmus school of Economics has four departments which includes the departments of Economics, Business Economics, Econometrics and Applied Economics.The departments are home to our talented academic staff who specialise in various branches such as behavioural economics, health economics, finance, marketing, data science, and many more.GroupDepartmentTinbergen Institute is one of the major economic research institutes in the Netherlands, founded in 1987 and named after Professor Jan Tinbergen, the Dutch Nobel Prize laureate in Economics (1969). TI has over 150 research fellows, over 200 PhD students, and over 770 PhD alumni. The TI research master program in Economics, Econometrics and Finance and the research master program in Business Data Science (BDS) are formally governed by the Amsterdam-Rotterdam Consortium for Graduate Education (ARC), a collaboration of the Erasmus University Rotterdam (EUR), University of Amsterdam (UvA) and Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (VU). TI has offices in Amsterdam and Rotterdam.While ARC is the umbrella organization, Tinbergen Institute is the name used by most to describe the research master programs and the surrounding research environment with graduate (PhD) education and TI research fellows. TI fellows organize and govern the graduate program, teach the courses, provide PhD supervision, and organize and participate in the institute’s research seminars and conferences.Additional informationPlease contact the institute director prof. Dr. E.J. (Eric) Bartelsman at e.j.bartelsman@vu.nl if you have any questions about this position or the institute.For more information on the procedure, you can contact Judith Mooren (HR Advisor) or Kim Beerentemfel-Laarman (HR officer a.i.) via hradvice@ese.eur.nl or via 06-81034244ApplyingPlease send your application (resumé and motivation letter) no later than Sunday 14 May 2023. IntroductionWe’re Hiring!Student Affairs Officer0,6 FTE - 0,8 FTE (24 - 32 hrs. p/w)We are looking to recruit a reliable and flexible student affairs officer to join our compact team (6 p.) of support staff at the Tinbergen Institute. Names after Professor Jan Tinbergen, the Dutch Nobel Prize laureate in Economics (1969), the Tinbergen Institute (TI), founded in 1987, is today one of the major economic research institutes in the Netherlands, with more than 150 research fellows, over 200 PhD and over 770 PhD alumni. The institute hosts nearly 100 research master students in two programs, one in economics, econometrics, and finance and the other in business data science. TI has offices in both Amsterdam and Rotterdam.Job DescriptionThe core focus of the student affairs officer is to:Provide administrative support to the Directors of Graduate Studies (2 DGS) and the education coordinator:support all facets of the highly selective research master programs, from welcoming the new students, to administering the courses, through graduation;communicate with teachers and fellows to maintain course guides and study manuals;ensure all courses, course schedules, enrollments, and grades are reflected in the educational monitoring system (Osiris) and learning environment system (Canvas);Provide administrative support for quality assurance. run the secretariat of the Examination Board. The above-mentioned tasks highlight just a few of the day-to-day activities and responsibilities and do not entail a complete overview.Job requirementsA successful candidate will have:a Bachelor degree or work experience on Bachelor level;You have at least 2 years of relevant work experience within an educational institution, preferably within a university or university of applied sciences;good knowledge of Dutch and English in word and writing (C1 level);a high level of integrity, accuracy, reliability, and ability to adapt to process changes;a combination of patience and the ability to work under deadline pressure;great team spirit: ability to collaborate with the rest of the staff, both academic and support staff, while working independently. Employment conditions and benefitsWe offer a contract with Erasmus University Rotterdam, initially for one year based on 0,6 - 0,8 fte (24 – 32 hrs. p/w). After this, the contract can be converted into a permanent position if the organisational conditions remain unchanged and performance is satisfactory.In accordance with the conditions applied at Erasmus University Rotterdam as indicated in the Collective Labour Agreement of the Dutch universities, the gross monthly salary is in the range € 2,818.- to € 3,764.- (scale 8, Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities) for full-time employment.In addition, we offer an 8% holiday allowance, an end-of-year payment of 8.3%, and a very generous paid leave scheme. Furthermore, EUR is affiliated with ABP for the pension provision, and we offer partially paid parental leave, fully paid extended birth leave for partners, a personal career budget, free and unlimited access to our online learning environment GoodHabitz, work-life balance coaches, discounted collective health insurance, and more. As an employee, you can also use EUR facilities such as the University library and receive a discount on subscriptions for the Erasmus sports center.Erasmus University Rotterdam aspires to be an equitable and inclusive community. We nurture an open culture, where everyone is supported to fulfil their full potential. We see inclusivity of talent as the basis of our successes, and the diversity of perspectives and people as a highly valued outcome. EUR provides equal opportunities to all employees and applicants regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, functional impairment, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes them unique. We look forward to welcoming you to our community.EmployerErasmus University Rotterdam (EUR) is an internationally oriented university with a strong social orientation in its education and research, as expressed in our mission ‘Creating positive societal impact’. EUR is home to 3.700 academics and professionals and almost 33.000 students from more than 140 countries. Everything we do, we do under the credo The Erasmian Way – Making Minds Matter. We’re global citizens, connecting, entrepreneurial, open-minded, and socially involved. These Erasmian Values function as our internal compass and create EUR’s distinctive and recognizable profile. From these values, with a broad perspective and with an eye for diversity, different backgrounds and opinions, our employees work closely together to solve societal challenges from the dynamic and cosmopolitan city of Rotterdam. Thanks to the high quality and positive societal impact of our research and education, EUR can compete with the top European universities. www.eur.nl.Faculty / Institute / Central serviceThe Erasmus school of Economics has four departments which includes the departments of Economics, Business Economics, Econometrics and Applied Economics.The departments are home to our talented academic staff who specialise in various branches such as behavioural economics, health economics, finance, marketing, data science, and many more.GroupDepartmentTinbergen Institute is one of the major economic research institutes in the Netherlands, founded in 1987 and named after Professor Jan Tinbergen, the Dutch Nobel Prize laureate in Economics (1969). TI has over 150 research fellows, over 200 PhD students, and over 770 PhD alumni. The TI research master program in Economics, Econometrics and Finance and the research master program in Business Data Science (BDS) are formally governed by the Amsterdam-Rotterdam Consortium for Graduate Education (ARC), a collaboration of the Erasmus University Rotterdam (EUR), University of Amsterdam (UvA) and Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (VU). TI has offices in Amsterdam and Rotterdam.While ARC is the umbrella organization, Tinbergen Institute is the name used by most to describe the research master programs and the surrounding research environment with graduate (PhD) education and TI research fellows. TI fellows organize and govern the graduate program, teach the courses, provide PhD supervision, and organize and participate in the institute’s research seminars and conferences.Additional informationPlease contact the institute director prof. Dr. E.J. The selection will consist of 2 rounds of interviews. The interviews are partly conducted in English.Internal candidates will be given priority over external candidates in case of equal suitability.Acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated.During the publication period, applications will be handled continuously. Heb je interesse in onderzoek op het gebied van volksgezondheid en psychologie? Lijkt het je leuk om bij te dragen aan een onderzoek naar online seksuele gezondheidszorg voor mannen die seks hebben met mannen? Heb jij goede projectmanagement vaardigheden? Ben je geïnteresseerd in de praktische aspecten van empirisch onderzoek? Wij zijn per direct op zoek naar een zeer gemotiveerde kandidaat voor een baan als onderzoeksassistent (0,4 fte) ter ondersteuning van een onderzoeksproject dat wordt uitgevoerd door GGD Amsterdam.Het project wordt geleid door een multidisciplinair team van wetenschappers van de afdeling Infectieziekten, team onderzoek en preventie, van de GGD Amsterdam en de programmagroep Sociale Psychologie van de Universiteit van Amsterdam.Wat ga je doenWe zijn op zoek naar een onderzoeksassistent voor het uitvoeren van diverse onderzoeksgerelateerde taken. De succesvolle sollicitant gaat samenwerken met Marije Groot Bruinderink, werkzaam bij de GGD Amsterdam en bij de afdeling Psychologie van de Universiteit van Amsterdam.Data management bijhouden van voltooide vragenlijsten en bloedspotkaarten, contacteren van deelnemers die afspraken t.a.v. data verzameling niet (tijdig) naleven, data controleren op compleetheid en juistheid;Onderzoek beschrijvende analyses uitvoeren, bijdragen aan het voorbereiden en implementeren van nieuwe vragenlijsten, literatuur opzoeken;Projectmanagement helpen met de organisatie van vergaderingen met de andere onderzoekslocaties en Soa Aids Nederland, administratieve taken gerelateerd aan de monitoring van een gerandomiseerde studie die onder de WMO-wetgeving valt.Wat neem je meeDe ideale sollicitant heeft affiniteit met het doen van empirisch onderzoek op het gebied van volksgezondheid en psychologie, en heeft een bijzondere interesse in de seksuele gezondheidszorg voor mannen die seks hebben met mannen. Je bent ruimdenkend, goed georganiseerd en proactief in het oplossen van problemen en moet aan de volgende criteria voldoenJe hebteen bachelordiploma psychologie;goede kennis van statistiek en bedreven in data-analyse;relevante administratieve en projectmanagementvaardigheden;je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en hebt goede Engelse taalvaardigheid.Je bentbereid en in staat om ongeveer 2 dagen per week te werken tot eind 2023;bereid om Stata (statistisch analyseprogramma) te leren.Wat bieden we jouHet betreft een tijdelijke aanstelling van 15,2 uur per week (0,4 fte) voor de duur van 6 maanden.Het salaris bedraagt, afhankelijk van opleiding en relevante werkervaring, minimaal €2.402 tot maximaal €2.611 bruto per maand bij een volledige aanstelling van 38 uur per week (conform schaal 6, https//www.vsnu.nl/cao-universiteiten.html). Daarnaast bieden we een uitgebreid pakket secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, waaronder een ruime vakantieregeling en een eindejaarsuitkeringWat bieden we je verder?We bieden je een motiverende werkomgeving waarin je kennis kunt maken met praktijkgericht onderzoek en bij te dragen het verbeteren van seksuele gezondheidszorg. Hiermee kan je waardevolle ervaring op doen voor een carrière in de wetenschap. Werktijden en locatie zijn flexibel.Over onsUniversiteit van AmsterdamDe Universiteit van Amsterdam is de grootste universiteit van Nederland, met het breedste opleidingsaanbod. Een intellectueel knooppunt met 39.000 studenten, 6.000 medewerkers en 3.000 promovendi. Verbonden door een cultuur van nieuwsgierigheid. Meer lezen.De Faculteit der Maatschappij- en Gedragswetenschappen speelt een leidende rol in het adresseren van de grote maatschappelijke uitdagingen waar de wereld, Nederland en Amsterdam mee worden geconfronteerd, nu en in de toekomst.Nieuwsgierig naar onze organisatie en aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals een ruime vakantieregeling en ontwikkelmogelijkheden? Hier lees je meer over werken bij de Universiteit van AmsterdamGGD AmsterdamDe GGD Amsterdam-Amstelland (1600 medewerkers) is de oudste Geneeskundige en Gezondheidsdienst van Nederland.Het team Onderzoek & Preventie bestaat uit 25 medewerkers, onder wie epidemiologen, psychologen, artsen, data managers, verpleegkundigen, en een statisticus. Het team doet sinds 1984 onderzoek naar infectieziekten, waaronder hiv en andere seksueel- en bloed overdraagbare aandoeningen; de samenwerking met Amsterdam UMC is structureel ingebed met de Academische Werkplaats Publieke Gezondheid, het Sarphati Initiatief. Bij de GGD zijn drie hoogleraren op het gebied van infectieziekten werkzaam.In 2023 wordt vanuit de afdeling Infectieziekten aan ongeveer 40 onderzoeksprojecten gewerkt, er worden per jaar meer dan 50 wetenschappelijke artikelen gepubliceerd en gemiddeld 3 promoties afgerond.VragenHeb je vragen of aanvullende informatie nodig? Neem contact op met Marije Groot Bruinderink (mgrootbruinderink@ggd.amsterdam.nl)SollicatieHerken jij jezelf in het functieprofiel? Dan zien we je sollicitatie graag uiterlijk 22 mei 2023 in één .pdf tegemoet.Sollicitatie in één 1 pdf bevat het volgendeMotivatiebrief (maximaal 1 pagina);Curriculum vitae; Cijferlijsten van jouw opleiding;Ten minste één voorbeeld van onderzoek-gerelateerde werkzaamheden, geef een link of voeg een document toe aan de pdf. Het mag een script voor data-analyse zijn, een schrijfopdracht, beschrijving van een onderzoeksproject, etc.Als werkgever handhaaft de UvA een beleid van gelijke kansen. We vinden diversiteit belangrijk en zetten ons volledig in om een plek te zijn waar iedereen zich thuis voelt. We koesteren de onderzoekende geest en het doorzettingsvermogen en laten de ruimte om door te vragen. Bij ons vormen nieuwsgierigheid en creativiteit de heersende cultuur.Wij stellen acquisitie niet op prijs.LI-AO-P Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Binnen het domein sociale wetenschappen zoeken we een enthousiaste en ambitieuze nieuwe directeur voor de Graduate School of Social Sciences (GSSS). Het collegiaal bestuur - bestaande uit vier afdelingsvoorzitters, de directeur van de onderzoeksschool AISSR en de directeuren van de onderwijsinstituten GSSS en CSW – werkt samen op basis van transparantie en wederzijds vertrouwen.De Graduate School of Social Sciences (GSSS) is met ruim 1000 studenten één van de grootste Graduate Schools binnen de UvA. Het instituut verzorgt 11 (research) Engelstalige masteropleidingen, een uitgebreid Summer-Winterschool programma en is medeverantwoordelijk voor de training van promovendi. Binnen Nederland biedt de GSSS het ruimste pakket aan sociaalwetenschappelijke opleidingen waar ook veel buitenlandse studenten (bijna 50% van de instroom) op af komen. De GSSS werkt nauw samen met het College Sociale Wetenschappen (CSW) waarmee zij een ondersteunend bureau deelt dat door de directeuren CSW en GSSS gezamenlijk wordt aangestuurd. Samen met CSW, onderzoeksinstituut AISSR, en de vier afdelingen Politicologie, Sociologie, Antropologie en Geografie, Planologie en Internationale Ontwikkelingsstudies vormt het GSSS het domein Sociale Wetenschappen. Op zijn beurt is dit domein één van de vier onderdelen van de Faculteit Maatschappij en Gedragswetenschappen (FMG).Het besturen van 11 opleidingen, binnen een domein met vier afdelingen, en het medeverantwoordelijk zijn voor de kwaliteit van de medewerkers van het onderwijsbureau met 90+ medewerkers, is een uitdagende opdracht voor kandidaten die gedijen bij onvoorspelbare gebeurtenissen en een bewegelijke werkomgeving. Onze kandidaat heeft in de eerste plaats hart voor (master)onderwijs en wil dit goed faciliteren, waardeert de bruisende, internationale en intellectuele werksfeer die wij kunnen bieden, bestuurt graag en goed, en is nieuwsgierig naar onze studenten en collega’s.Wat ga je doenDe onderwijsdirecteur is verantwoordelijk/draagt zorg voorde opleidingen van de GSSS, binnen de gegeven facultaire, universitaire en landelijke beleidskaders; het financiële, personele en logistieke reilen en zeilen van het hele domein in collegiaal – loyaal en solidair - bestuur met de directeuren van het college (CSW) en het onderzoeksinstituut (AISSR) en de voorzitters van de vier afdelingen van Sociale Wetenschappen; het in overleg met de betrokken afdelingsvoorzitters selecteren van opleidingsdirecteuren voor de GSSS masterprogramma's; inhoudelijk leiding geven aan en facilitering van deze opleidingsdirecteuren (die verantwoordelijk zijn voor de inhoud, organisatie en uitvoering van het onderwijs binnen de opleidingen);een adequate inrichting en organisatie van de afzonderlijke GSSS programma's met het oog op gestelde doelen t.a.v. kwaliteit, tevredenheid van studenten, studiesucces van studenten en binnen financiele randvoorwaarden;periodieke evaluatie van de GSSS programma's in het licht van ontwikkelingen binnen de verschillende vakgebieden, de academische wereld en het werkveld; bevorderen van periodieke aanpassing/herziening van programma's door de betrokken opleidingsdirecteur(en) gezien de evaluatie-uitkomsten; toezien op implementatie van vernieuwde curricula;de (her)accreditatie van opleidingen;vertegenwoordiging van de opleidingen op facultair, universitair en universiteits-overstijgend niveau; in samenspraak met het AISSR het onderwijs aan promovendi en zorgdragen voor het het verbeteren van de samenwerking rond en de visie op onderwijs in het promotietraject;de financiën van de Graduate School en voor de jaarlijks terugkerende cyclus van financiële planning en realisatie van de (research) masteropleidingen en het ervoor zorgen dat de Graduate School en haar afzonderlijk opleidingen binnen de afgesproken financiele kaders opereren; een voortdurend en transparant inzicht in de baten en lasten, zowel van de GSSS als geheel als van de afzonderlijke onderdelen en opleidingen (en in relatie tot de andere financiële onderdelen van het domein – College Sociale Wetenschappen en onderzoeksinstituut). De directeuren College en GSSS worden hierbij ondersteund door de bedrijfsvoerder onderwijs;vormgeving van onderwijsondersteunende processen en sturing op de dienstverlening door het Education Office Social Sciences (EOSS) op hoofdlijnen, met oog voor de professionele autonomie van de onderwijsondersteunende medewerkers, in samenwerking met de directeur College en hierbij ondersteund door het bureauhoofd EOSS; het belang van onderwijs waarborgen bij benoemingen en bevorderingen van wetenschappelijke staf.Wat neem je meeDe nieuwe onderwijsdirecteuris als hoogleraar of UHD werkzaam bij een van de vier afdelingen in het domein sociale wetenschappen;heeft een visie op het masteronderwijs en is in staat strategisch te opereren om die visie – en het domeinbrede beleid – te realiseren;heeft affiniteit met, en positief geëvalueerde ervaring in masteronderwijs binnen de Sociale Wetenschappen; heeft aantoonbare bestuurlijke ervaring en heeft daarbij blijk gegeven van gevoel voor bestuurlijke verhoudingen en bestuurlijk geduld; heeft aantoonbare ervaring met leidinggeven en met complexe besluitvormingsprocessen; heeft belangstelling en talent voor de financiën van een onderwijsorganisatie; ervaring hiermee is een pré; heeft oog voor onderwijslogistieke processen; ervaring hiermee is een pré; stuurt inhoudelijk op hoofdlijnen, geeft ruimte aan de professionaliteit en visie van opleidingsdirecteuren, en vertrouwt voor de details op de hiertoe benoemde personen; heeft respect en oog voor de professionele autonomie en lokale expertise van alle betrokkenen; heeft in zowel het Nederlands als het Engels een zeer goede schriftelijke en mondelinge uitdrukkingsvaardigheid;is bereid om voor het hele domein te werken, heeft oog voor verschillende belangen en is in staat constructieve samenwerking te bevorderen;is een verbindend, egalitair en faciliterend leider die er plezier in heeft om draagvlak en consensus te creëren bij zowel de aangesloten opleidingen als de ondersteunende staf, maar is ook bereid beslissingen te nemen en te verdedigen; kan omgaan met de verhoudingen in een domein waarin vier afdelingen zowel op het gebied van onderwijs als onderzoek met gedeelde middelen samen werken; kan verschillen van visie respecteren en zich inleven in de verschillende actoren en hun belangen; heeft mensenkennis, is benaderbaar, heeft sterke communicatievaardigheden en is sociaal; houdt contact met de werkvloer;is beschikbaar vanaf 1 december 2023. Wat bieden we jouHet betreft een benoeming voor de rol van onderwijsdirecteur van 19 uur per week, binnen een wetenschappelijke (WP) aanstelling binnen het domein Sociale Wetenschappen, voor de duur van 4 jaar. Naast de taken van onderwijsdirecteur is er ruimte voor onderwijs en onderzoek. Bij gebleken geschiktheid en ongewijzigde organisatorische inrichting bestaat de optie om de benoeming daarna nog eens met 4 jaar te verlengen.De vergoeding voor deze taken betreft een toelage van 500 euro per maand bruto.Wat bieden we je verdereen uitdagende functie met afwisselende werkzaamheden en volop ruimte voor eigen initiatief en ontwikkeling bij een inspirerende organisatie; een functie waarbij eigen initiatief en input sterk gewaardeerd worden;een enthousiast en warm team dat openstaat voor nieuwe collega’s;een inspirerende academische en internationale werkomgeving in het hart van Amsterdam.Over onsDe Universiteit van Amsterdam is de grootste universiteit van Nederland, met het breedste opleidingsaanbod. Een intellectueel knooppunt met 41.000 studenten, 6.000 medewerkers en 3.000 promovendi. Verbonden door een cultuur van nieuwsgierigheid. Meer lezen.De Faculteit der Maatschappij- en Gedragswetenschappen speelt een leidende rol in het adresseren van de grote maatschappelijke uitdagingen waar de wereld, Nederland en Amsterdam mee worden geconfronteerd, nu en in de toekomst.De onderwijsinstituten ‘College Sociale Wetenschappen (CSW)’ en ‘Graduate School of Social Sciences’ (GSSS) maken onderdeel uit van FMG en zijn samen verantwoordelijk voor zes bachelor- en elf masteropleidingen en een aantal niet-reguliere programma's, zoals zomerprogramma's en deficiëntieonderwijs. Bij elkaar volgen meer dan 5000 studenten onderwijs aan het CSW en de GSSS.CSW en GSSS hebben een gezamenlijk Onderwijsbureau (EOSS)De volgende opleidingen vallen onder de GSSS Conflict Resolution & Governance Cultural and Social Anthropology Human Geography International Development Studies Medical Anthropology and Sociology Political Science Sociology Urban and Regional Planning RM International Development Studies RM Social Sciences RM Urban StudiesNieuwsgierig naar onze organisatie en ontwikkelmogelijkheden? Hier lees je meer over werken bij de Universiteit van Amsterdam.VragenVoor vragen over de functie of de afdeling kun je tijdens kantooruren contact opnemen metJochem de Vries, Voorzitter bestuur sociale wetenschappen, j.devries1@uva.nl ; T +31 20 5256052, ofAnnemarie Zand Scholten, onderwijsdirecteur CSW, T +31 619596811SollicitatieHerken je je in het profiel en ben je geïnteresseerd in de functie, dan zien we je sollicitatie graag tegemoet. Je kunt via onderstaande link online solliciteren. We ontvangen graag een motivatiebrief en cv als pdf-bestand.De reactietermijn sluit op 14 mei 2023. Sollicitaties die we na de reactietermijn ontvangen, die niet via de link worden verstuurd, of niet compleet zijn, kunnen we helaas niet in behandeling nemen.De sollicitatiegesprekken vinden naar verwachting plaats in de week van 29 mei en 5 juni (voorlopig 30 mei en 1 juni eerste gespreksronde, 5 juni tweede gespreksronde), gelieve hier rekening mee te houden.Als werkgever handhaaft de UvA een beleid van gelijke kansen. We vinden diversiteit belangrijk en zetten ons volledig in om een plek te zijn waar iedereen zich thuis voelt. We koesteren de onderzoekende geest en het doorzettingsvermogen en laten de ruimte om door te vragen. Bij ons vormen nieuwsgierigheid en creativiteit de heersende cultuur.Wij stellen acquisitie niet op prijs. Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Are you interested in making a valuable contribution to the education of students in our Master of Information Studies program? Do you want to be part of a program that has been renowned for years for its high quality, small scale and intensive approach to teaching both the theoretical and practical aspects of information systems and data science? Then apply now for the position of Assistant Lecturer in our Master of Information Studies program.The Master of Information Studies program is part of the Graduate School of Informatics within the Faculty of Science at the University of Amsterdam. The program comprises two tracks, Information Systems and Data Science, which are aligned with the research expertise of the Informatics Institute. The courses in the program are taught by researchers from the Informatics Institute, with the support of a team of enthusiastic Assistant Lecturers.What are you going to do?As an Assistant Lecturer, you will work closely with the course coordinators who are responsible for the theoretical and pedagogical aspects of the courses. You will assist with the practical educational matters of the program and provide guidance and coaching to students with their courses and master thesis projects. This position gives you the opportunity to have a real impact on the learning experience of students since you will be closely involved with both the courses and studentsYour tasks and responsibilitiesPreparing and making small adaptions to course material for lectures, tutorials, workshops, and seminars.Participating in the supervision of practical coursework, advising students on skills, methods, and techniques to help them acquire knowledge.Supporting students in organizing and executing their Master thesis research, including the organization and supervision of academic processes.Participating in the assessment process using a variety of methods and techniques to provide effective, timely, and appropriate feedback to students to support their learning.Organizing extracurricular activities for students, such as ad-hoc workshops and social events, to enhance their learning experience.Engaging in professional development to remain current and ensure the application of recent advances in knowledge to teaching.To qualify for this position, you must have A Master of Science degree in computer science, artificial intelligence, information science, or a related discipline.Teaching experience and course administration experience.Good organizational and planning skills.Ability to work independently and as part of a team.Pro-active and flexible attitude.Ability to accept collegiate responsibilities and act accordingly.Good communication skills, both orally and written, and a good command of the English language.Please note that Non-native Dutch speakers must be willing to obtain B2 level proficiency in the Dutch language.Our offerA temporary contract of 4 years (with a 2 month probation period) for 38 hours per week.The salary, depending on relevant experience before the beginning of the employment contract, will be € 2,960 to € 4,670 (scale 10) gross per month, based on a fulltime contract (38 hours a week). This is exclusive 8% holiday allowance and 8.3% end-of-year bonus. A favourable tax agreement, the ‘30% ruling’, may apply to non-Dutch applicants. The Collective Labour Agreement of Dutch Universities is applicable.The Faculty of Science offers you a four-year contract, which includes 0.1 FTE dedicated to training and development. This combination of working as a lecturer while following training is called the Lecturer Development Program (Docent Ontwikkel Programma, DOP). The purpose of the DOP is to optimise your position on the job market (employability and career opportunities) once your temporary employment comes to an end. During the course of your four-year contract, you will follow training modules together with other junior lecturers; this will include the opportunity to obtain the University Teaching Qualification (UTQ). Together with your supervisor, you will draw up a Personal Development Plan (Persoonlijk Ontwikkelplan, POP) detailing the specifics of your customised program.NB! It is not possible to offer this contract to candidates who are currently, or in the past 6 months, employed at the University of Amsterdam. Your possible application will therefore not be processed for that reason.The UvA has an extensive package of fringe benefits, including29 vacation days for full-time employment & additional vacation days between Christmas and the turn of the year;Mobile phone and a laptop;Reimbursement of commuting expenses (of travel cost allowance);Pension accrual at ABP for which UvA pays two third part of the contribution;You have the flexibility to combine work and private life, with the option of working from home;By working two hours more than your working hours each week, you will receive 96 compensation hours on an annual basis. The same applies if you are part-timer;In addition, the UvA offers excellent study and development opportunities and encourages employees to continue to develop themselves;You may participate in the open UvA lectures, which earn you a maximum of 30 credits per year. Are you curious about all our extensive package of secondary employment benefits like our excellent opportunities for study and development? Take a look here.About UsThe University of Amsterdam is the Netherlands' largest university, offering the widest range of academic programmes. At the UvA, 30,000 students, 6,000 staff members and 3,000 PhD candidates study and work in a diverse range of fields, connected by a culture of curiosity.The Faculty of Science has a student body of around 8,000, as well as 1,800 members of staff working in education, research or support services. Researchers and students at the Faculty of Science are fascinated by every aspect of how the world works, be it elementary particles, the birth of the universe or the functioning of the brain.The mission of the Informatics Institute (IvI) is to perform curiosity-driven and use-inspired fundamental research in Computer Science. The main research themes are Artificial Intelligence, Computational Science and Systems and Network Engineering. Our research involves complex information systems at large, with a focus on collaborative, data driven, computational and intelligent systems, all with a strong interactive component.Want to know more about our organisation? Read more about working at the University of Amsterdam.Any questions?Do you have any questions or do you require additional information?
